dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cramped. EMILY CALE (10) slumbers. A stack of magazines b her bed. US Weekly. Teen People. The Economist. We hear a cell phone BOOP. Emily stirs. Checks her batter first gen iPhone. An email notification. The screen reads President's Treaty With Iran Draws Criticism at G8 Summit. Emily goes to the CNN app. Pulls the covers over her head A kid sneaking TV, except in this case, it's not cartoons it's Wolf Blitzer:

dialogues.speaker: WOLF BLITZER
dialogues.text: ...The proposed treaty with the newly elected moderate President of Iran, Mehrak Al-Said, is drawing huge criticism for the Sawyer administration. The President was booed when he took the stage to speak in Geneva over the weekend... Drowned out by a LOW RUMBLING. Windows rattling. Emily's bed begins SHAKING. Earthquake? Emily leaps up, huge smil on her face. Throws the window open and looks up to see A COLUMN OF HELICOPTERS thundering overhead! Three dark green VH-3D Sea King choppers, each with United States of America emblazoned on the side...

dialogues.speaker: MARINE ONE
dialogues.text: Leads the Presidential Motorcade of the sky. Emily looks in wonder as Marine One and her two thundering companions bank East towards the dawn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabin holds ten. Nine men in suits. One woman in the front jump seat. Secret Service AGENT CAROL FINNERTY (30' Smart pant suit, gun on her hip. She keys her wrist mic:

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Castle, this is Hummingbird, we are inbound from Andy, three minutes out--

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRIGGS
dialogues.text: Carol? Finnerty looks up to see Agent BRIAN GRIGGS across from h

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRIGGS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He wants to do the thing. Finnerty sighs.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRIGGS
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Mr. President, it's not a good idea to deviate from the flight plan... She's now looking into the smiling face of PRESIDENT JAME SAWYER, the 46th Chief Executive of the United States. Handsome, 40's, African-American.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Come on, Carol, pretty please? Leader of the free world here, saying 'pretty please' here. Oughta count for something. A beat. Finnerty keys her radio mic.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Captain Joffrey, this is Agent Finnerty? The President would like to do the thing. The others grin as the helicopter banks left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautifully illuminated. A JOGGER and his dog, huffing an puffing by when MARINE ONE sweeps in low overhead, coming down 23rd Stree The two escort choppers playing follow-the-leader behind circling the Memorial, saying hello to Mr. Lincoln. The column of choppers turns East, flying out over the reflecting pool! An air tour of the sights...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Sawyer smiles in his seat as he watches Lincoln recede. As they make a wide arc around the Washington Monument, their destination comes into view -- THE WHITE HOUSE. All lit up. Spectacular.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Be it ever so humble...

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: (into wrist walkie) Castle, this is Hummingbird, we are one minute out, I need a go/no go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A structure on the North side of the White House Grounds, Pennsylvania Avenue. Inside, packed with electronics. The GUARD sits hunched over a monitor system that shows d of traffic camera feeds from the streets around the compl

dialogues.speaker: GATE GUARD
dialogues.text: Hummingbird, this is Castle Ground, you are clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low lit. Two dress MARINES sit in the outer office. A NAV RADAR TECH watches his screen sweep for nearby air traffi

dialogues.speaker: RADAR TECH
dialogues.text: Hummingbird, this is Castle Sky, you are clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High atop the famous columned central building, a black c SNIPER TEAM scans the night sky with their rifle-scopes, checking surrounding buildings for movement.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD SNIPER
dialogues.text: Hummingbird, this is Castle Keep, you are- Hold. THROUGH HIS NIGHTSCOPE - We see movement on the eighth fl balcony of a building a half mile away. He frowns. Enhanc magnification. The suspicious behavior comes into focus.. A couple having sex on their balcony. The Lead Sniper gri

dialogues.speaker: LEAD SNIPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hummingbird, this is Castle Keep, you are clear. The column of helicopters swoops in, circling the South L The Lead Chopper pulls a slow turn, coming in for a landi A pair of MARINES in dress blues come out to meet it. The door does not open. The Chopper sits there for a good twenty seconds as the snipers continue to scan. Then:

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through radio) Castle Keep?

dialogues.speaker: LEAD SNIPER
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through radio) All right, Decoy up, Marine One in. The chopper on the ground rises up and the second helicop the real Marine One - swoops in for a landing on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MARINES open the door and President Sawyer steps off bird, flanked by Finnerty, Dawson, and aides. Sawyer snap the Marines a salute as they head for the White House.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: It's really not a bad way to travel, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It beats Dupont Circle, sir.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: When's my wife back?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Not until tonight.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get some shut-eye. Wake me if we need to attack anything. In front of him, more Marines hold open the door to the W colonnade. As the President passes them, walking inside:

dialogues.speaker: MARINE GUARD
dialogues.text: Welcome home, sir. Finnerty looks back at Marine One as it lifts off the Sou Lawn. An incredible sight. Griggs smiles next to her.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRIGGS
dialogues.text: Tell me we don't have the best job in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two other Secret Service Agents stand a very different de Guarding a broken down row house in Georgetown. The first is handsome, close cropped hair. This is JOHN CALE (30's) A HORRIBLE COUGHING comes from inside. Wheezy and phlegmy like a grown man trying to hack up a furball.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, God... The coughing resumes. Awful. The agents wince. Then:

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Is there any kleenex out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clutching a box of kleenex, Cale raps on the bathroom doo It opens and ELI RAPHELSON (70) sticks his head out. Clad in a ratty bathrobe, still wheezing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, John. When I'm done in here, I'll make you some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I'm fine, Mr. Speaker-

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: I insist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raphelson stands at the stove, mixing what looks to be th world's worst cup of instant coffee. A TV tuned to CNN replays the President's Geneva Speech:

dialogues.speaker: PRESDIENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: (on TV) ...-There are those who will say we are foolish, those who treat every opportunity for peace as a show of weakness. To them I say I have found a friend in President Al-Said. And together, we will prove that the pen truly is mightier than the sword. Applause mixed with boos. Raphelson adds way too much cre to the coffee. Looks to Cale.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: What do you think of all this?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I don't know, sir. It's good to have less enemies.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: All he's doing is legitimizing them. Geopolitics is chess, not checkers; you have to see the whole board. The President is very naive sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Why didn't you run against him?

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Because that is the one job I never wanted. I like my constituents, I like being a thorn in the side of the administration. Not all of us are looking to move up. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casual) You have your interview today? Cale looks at him, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you want to be on the President's detail. Are you not pleased with your life of excitement and adventure here?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Sir, I- I appreciate everything you've done for me, but-

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: It's all right, son. It's good to have ambition. I'll be sorry to see you go is all. This may not be the White House, but there's coffee. He slides a mug over to Cale. Cale takes a sip. Awful. Hides it well. He likes the old guy. Raphelson nods, happ

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now in a suit, Raphelson climbs behind the wheel of his battered Toyota Camry and fires it up. Cale slides into t SUV idling behind him - the follow car. Into his wrist:

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Pinball is rolling, we are enroute to Punchbowl. As they roll out after Raphelson, we pan around to see th destination in the distance, what "Punchbowl" really is THE U.S. CAPITOL DOME. Silhouetted against the rising sun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McLean, Virginia. An alarm clocks wails. The lone figure wakes. This is MARTIN BISHOP (late 50's). Fit, trim. He sits a moment. Alone in a house for two. Then rises. A SERIES OF QUICK CUTS - Bishop showers, shaves. Pulls on pants, a button down shirt. Selects a tie. Withdraws a GLOCK. Checks the load. Straps it into his shoulder holst  A small silver cross hangs from his mirror. He takes it. Slips it around his neck. Looks at himself. He stands there for a long time. Bishop takes the cross off. Hangs it back on the mirror. Pulls on his suit coat and is out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale and Dunleavy shadow a briskly walking Raphelson as h climbs the famous steps. Cale, scanning passersby for any sign of potential threat. Everything okay until he spies A long haired FIDGETY GUY. He keeps scratching his beard and eyeing the Speaker. Cale, about to say something when the Fidgety Guy suddenly reaches into his coat and -- TIME SLOWS DOWN. Cale pivots to block Raphelson, his own hand drifts to the holster on his hip, about to pull, but Fidgety Guy's faster and his gun hand emerges brandishing A banana. Fidgety Guy's breakfast. Cale exhales.

dialogues.speaker: DUNLEAVY
dialogues.text: You okay there, Tex? Too much coffee? Cale doesn't respond. They head up the steps and inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raphelson walks the halls, saying hello to various Congre as they arrive for work. Stepping into a big office where AGENTS KELLERMAN and BRIGHT stands guard. Cale steps up.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: He watched Jeopardy, went to bed to at 8:00, got up to pee twice, and is still having that allergy thing. We need to start keeping kleenex in the downstairs bathroom. He's all yours.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN
dialogues.text: I'll try not to die of excitement. Cale smiles. Heads down the hall to an even bigger office

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hustle and bustle. An assistant sits at the front desk, rolling calls. JENNA (30's), sweet and flirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Office of the Vice President. Hold please. She sees Cale and flashes him her best smile.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Did you get them?

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: What do I get if I did?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Dinner, candlelight, and a sincere promise that you'll try to get to second base.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Done. She hands him an envelope and a card with her phone numbe on it. Cale looks inside the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's gonna love these, Jenna. Thanks! He kisses her on the cheek and is out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily sits at the kitchen table, sullenly picking at her cereal. Her mother MELANIE (30's, hard), mixes vodka from the freezer in with her morning OJ. The former Mrs. Cale. A knock on the door. Melanie opens it. Cale.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: You're late. She thought you weren't coming.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Of course I was coming. Emily, get your stuff. Emily grabs her bag and heads out the door. As she passes Cale he tries to kiss her on the forehead, but she dodges Melanie smiles at this. A small victory for her side.  10.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: You missed her talent show.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: When was her talent show?

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: What did she do?

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: She was a flag twirler.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: That's a talent?

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: She practiced for like six weeks and her own father can't be bothered to show up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, sitting in the car, listening to her parents fight Old news. She slips on her headphones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale nods to the vodka bottle.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Getting an early start, I see.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Why not? It's my day off. Cale has a retort, but swallows it. Instead:

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Listen, I wanted to talk about custody-

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: I'm sure you do. That way you don't have to cut me that check every month-

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: You really think this is about the checks, Mel?  11. He stares at her drink. She shifts her weight from one fo to the other, then shakes her head and chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Jesus, John. She doesn't even like you. That lands. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: You have a good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale gets into the driver's seat. Emily listening to musi checking the Drudge Report on her phone. Cale looks at he

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: You pissed at me? She doesn't even look up at him. Hell hath no fury.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You gonna be on that thing all day? She's texting now. After a moment, Cale's own phone chime He checks it. Text from Emily - Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm so glad I got you that phone. (sighs) Well, I guess you won't be wanting these then... He puts the envelope from Jenna on the dash. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Lame.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: You don't even know what it is.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Do you really think that's going to work? We're both adults here, John.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Speak for yourself. Open the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What is it?  12.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: A pony. Just open it. Dubious, Emily opens the envelope. Her face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Are you serious? I didn't think they even gave White House tours anymore!

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: They don't. It's a six month waiting list unless you know people. I thought a budding policy wonk like you might want to see where the most powerful man in the world lives. She looks up at him. Genuinely happy.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: This is really cool, John.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: (starting the car) We're really sticking with the John thing, huh? As Emily nods, they pull out into traffic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale drives as Emily surfs her phone.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Listen, when we get there I have to go to a quick meeting, okay? Then we can go on the tour.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (reading off her phone) Did you know that 1.5 million people visit the White House every year?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I did not.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: That works out to about 5000 people a day.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Fascinating. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pause) I'm sorry I missed your talent show.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I'm not. Did you know the White House was originally called the Presidential Palace?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I'm serious. I wish I'd been there.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: No you, don't. All I did was twirl a flag, it was stupid. Cale looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: You don't have to do that, you know.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Have a thick skin. You're ten. Emily doesn't respond. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you really think I wasn't coming? But Emily's not looking at him, she's looking at...

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Oh, wow... THE WHITE HOUSE. Approaching from the South Side, with th fountain blasting. Enough to take Emily's breath away. Cale smiles at her reaction, driving up to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale pulls up to the massive guard gate. The Officer in Charge leans out of the structure.

dialogues.speaker: GATE GUARD
dialogues.text: Morning folks! Gonna need some photo

dialogues.speaker: ID
dialogues.text: Cale hands it over. Instantly two other guards appear fro nowhere, each holding long mirrors at the end of poles.  14. They sweep the bottom of the car for explosives. One guard checks the trunk while the other roots through back seat. Emily takes a picture of him with her phone.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What are you guys looking for?

dialogues.speaker: GATE GUARD 2
dialogues.text: Explosives.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: This is awesome.

dialogues.speaker: GATE GUARD
dialogues.text: (handing ID's back) Park up on the left and you're going to the East Lobby. Have a good one. Cale drives on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale pulls to a halt next to a parked SOUNDTEK van. A HUG MAN with a SHAVED HEAD is pulling a large speaker box out the back onto a dolly. Cale, watching him...

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Did you know the President travels in an eight ton military armored modified Cadillac CTS, built to withstand gas, chemical, and missile attacks?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: That's on the internet?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Wikipedia. You guys are doing a bang-up job with the secrecy thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey wood panelling. A GUARD DESK to the right, by set o metal detectors. Beyond, two more security checkpoints. X ray, body scan, bag search, facial rec. Serious stuff. On the walls hang Presidential Portraits. Roosevelt. Eisenhower. They lived here. Emily stares at them as Cale loads their stuff into the x-ray machine.  15.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICER
dialogues.text: Welcome to the White House! We're going to take you through three levels of security today. First, I'm going to need to empty your pockets - all metal objects in the tray please. Cell phones and cameras are permitted on the premises, but need to be examined by the agents first! OVERALLED WORKMEN lay tools on the x-ray belt. Photo ID's checked against internet records. Cale, to the officer:

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I'm Secret Service, off duty, I'm carrying.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICER
dialogues.text: You're going to have to check your weapon, sir. The officer produces a LOCKBOX. Cale unholsters his Glock and places it inside. The officer locks it and hands it t an AGENT. As Cale and Emily continue through security... CAMERA FOLLOWS the Agent carrying the lockbox, as he take it down into the bowels of the White House. Down a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concrete stairs, dimly lit. Past another agent into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark carpeted hallway. Down the corridor, round a corne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WEAPONS CAGE. The Armory Master looks up briefly as the Agent logs in Cale's lockbox. Pan off this to the countle ASSAULT RIFLES and SHOTGUNS locked behind steel mesh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale and Emily sit, waiting. Awkward silence again. Emily on her phone, surfing. After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: How's school?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: School blows.  16.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I'm glad we can have these talks. The outer office door opens and Finnerty enters.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispering to Emily) Do me a favor, for the next twenty seconds pretend you don't hate me.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: John Cale? I'm Carol Finnerty, I run the President's detail.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: (vising) This is my daughter Emily.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: My father is a very special man.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: That's... good to know. If you'll follow me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty settles in behind her desk as Cale takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: You often bring small children to job interviews?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Diversionary tactic. While I'm in here, she's out there stealing everything that's not nailed down. (no response) Sorry, that was a joke.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: All evidence to the contrary.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Mr. Cale, I'm going on seventeen hours of no sleep, so let's just get through this, okay? She opens the file sitting in front of her and reads.  She looks 17.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: John Cale, born 1983, Columbus, Ohio, public school, track and field, and then one single solitary semester at San Diego State University. Married your childhood sweetheart five months later, bounced from job to job. Mechanic, limo driver, construction-

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Is my credit score in there too?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Yes, and you should be ashamed of yourself. You finally landed in the Army Reserve. Enlisted for the bonus.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Is that a crime?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: We tend to prefer God and Country to "in it for the paycheck". Did two tours in Afghanistan, was wounded in the Kunar Province, received the Purple Heart. A Lance Corporal Brian Dawson put you up for a Silver Star, but you did not receive it.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: It's an honor just to be nominated.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: You pulled Corporal Dawson from a burning Humvee. Why?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I was somewhat concerned he was getting too warm in there. at him.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: It's funny to me that you think glib is the way to go here.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: There was an IED attack, the Humvee flipped, and we were taking fire. Everyone else bolted, I grabbed him.  18.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Because we don't leave men behind. (pause) And he owed me money.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Corporal Dawson happens to be the nephew of the Speaker of the House. And when you were discharged from the Army, the Speaker urged you to go into the Secret Service.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: He was kind enough to recommend me for a job.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: You're on the Speaker's detail now. He did you a favor.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: You could say that.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: I did. Why do you want to be on the President's detail?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Nothing against the Speaker, but no one's ever going to take a shot at him. This is the big leagues. She studies him.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Look, I appreciate your service, but this is clearly the record of a man who's slid by mostly on looks, charm, and favors-

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Mostly on the looks, actually-

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: -And as you say, this is the big leagues.  19.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I know I've bounced around, but this is something I can do. Giving yourself up for something greater than you... that's what I need.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but the Secret Service is not somewhere to find yourself. Thanks for coming in. She rises and offers her hand. Cale blinks. Surprised it' over. Rises too. Shakes and turns to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily looks up as Cale emerges.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: How'd it go? Cale's face says it all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty strides through the lobby, passing the Photo Off and Homeland Security. Keycards through another door into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The on-site security hub of the White House. 40 odd agents, some in uniform, some in suit and tie, sta drinking coffee, talking with each other. Shift change co up, but before that, the morning briefing. Finnerty slides into the back of the room as MARTIN BISHO walks to the front. Head of the Secret Service. The Boss.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: All right, listen up. First and most importantly, who owes me money on the Wizards? Grumbling throughout the agents, some come forward and ha him cash.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's right. Thank you. I hope you've all learned a valuable lesson here. Okay, light day. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Eagle is not leaving the Castle. Phone calls with the leadership staring at nine, photo spray with the Duke women's lacrosse team at noon, lunch with the Vice President, and then the First Lady is back tonight. Ted? AGENT TED HOPE (40's), prematurely balding speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HOPE
dialogues.text: Empress is wheels down at 18:45. They're supposed to have dinner of the residence but... He spreads his hands - "You know how they are".

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Assuming they call an audible on going out, we need to have advance on Dino, Obelisk, and Marcel's.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HOPE
dialogues.text: What if she wants sushi? From the back of the room, Finnerty speaks up:

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: No, she's off sushi, she had that thing on the Japan trip.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Jesus, Carol, how are you still awake?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Five Hour Energy Drink and patriotism, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: You have a Threat Matrix for us?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Homeland says a guy they were sitting on in Toronto went missing 36 hours ago, they think he might have crossed.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: This guy a lone nut or well financed horseman of the apocalypse?  21.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: College student with a blog, thinks the WTO caused 9/11.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: He's onto us. Okay, distribute the photo. Visitors today?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HOPE
dialogues.text: We have Representatives Fiske, Holden, Rafferty, and Senators Simon and Truesdale coming in for a budget meeting at 15:00, plus Soundtek is here again today.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Soundtek?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HOPE
dialogues.text: AV guys, they're replacing the surround system in the movie theater. Eagle wants it ready for football on Sunday. From all accounts, they are teeth rattlingly loud.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: The First Lady should be thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: All right, that's game. Grab an Order of the Day and let's get to work. The Agents grab top-sheets from a stack by the coffee. As they file out Finnerty approaches Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For the love of all that is holy, go get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: I'm going. (as he watches the Agents file out) You know you're going to miss this.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: I'm not, actually.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: I can tell when you're lying, you know. We're gonna miss you, too.  22. Bishop smiles at her. A little sad.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: All that time in Switzerland, it would have killed you to bring Muriel back a cuckoo clock?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: On your desk. (she turns to go) Twenty bucks says they pick Marcel's tonight.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: I wouldn't bet against you. Bishop, watching her go. Something eating at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale and Emily stand with a tour group of ten. At the fro stands DONNIE THE TOUR GUIDE (40's). Way too chipper.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: I'm Donnie and I'm going to be your guide today as we take a walk through American History! First I want to give you a big Washington DC welcome to the White House, where we get millions of guests a year from all corners of the globe! (to Cale) Where are you folks from?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Washington DC.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: Okay, bad choice. (to a Fat Woman) How about you, ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: FAT WOMAN
dialogues.text: I'm from North Carolina.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: And what brings you to the White House today?

dialogues.speaker: FAT WOMAN
dialogues.text: I wanna see the tunnels where JFK snuck Marilyn Monroe in.  23.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, those don't exist. (the Fat Woman is crestfallen) But we do have some other really exciting sights to show you! If you'll follow me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful solarium with a corner windows looking out on the South Lawn of the White House. Bright and sunny. As Donnie talks he leads them through.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: Does anyone want to guess how old the White House is? (sees Emily raising her hand) Young lady?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: 221 years old.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: That's... very accurate. Construction was begun in 1792 on what was then called the President's House. Article One, Section Eight of the US Constitution set forth that a district of not more than ten miles square should house the new seat of government. Does anyone know why?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: So no one state could claim the President's House.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: Right again. The founders were crafty. They figured if the President lived in one state then he would be beholden to that state above all others. But if he lived in a district separate from all of them, then he and his government could serve all the United States equally and fairly. In many ways, the entire city of Washington, the whole District of Columbia, was built from the ground up in order to hold this one house.  24. As they step into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long white corridor with a red brick floor wall of wind looking out to the South Lawn.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: The White House is actually three buildings; the East Wing, where you came in, the West Wing, which houses the Oval and Executive offices of the President, and the Residence, which is the big famous building in the center. These three buildings are connected by two long hallways called colonnades; we're in the East Colonnade right now. The colonnades were originally built by Thomas Jefferson to house horses, but now function to connect the complex together. And trust me, it needs connecting - the White House is big. Including below ground levels, the White House is six stories tall, with 132 rooms, 412 doors, 147 windows, 28 fireplaces, 8 staircases, 3 elevators and 35 bathrooms. The grounds contain a tennis court, a basketball court, a putting green, a jogging track, and a swimming pool. They pass an open door, hearing hammering and drilling.

dialogues.speaker: FAT WOMAN
dialogues.text: What's in there?

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: The President's home theater. (smiles) Membership has it's privileges. Cale glances inside, as seven burly SOUNDTEK WORKMEN dril holes into the walls of the theater...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another part of the building. PRESIDENT SAWYER sweeps dow the hallway, the Chief of Staff and Bishop at his side. Walking through an open door into  25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRESIDENT'S ASSISTANTS sit at three desks and the doo to the Oval proper is guarded by a DRESS MARINE holding a 16. To the Marine:

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Morning, Kenny.

dialogues.speaker: DRESS MARINE
dialogues.text: Morning, sir.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: The New York Times called my treaty a boondoggle this morning. You read the New York Times, Kenny?

dialogues.speaker: DRESS MARINE
dialogues.text: I'm more of a Daily News man, sir.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Bill, we need to talk to the Secretary of the Navy about getting Kenny a raise. Margaret, can you get me the Speaker of the House please? I sense a lecture in my future... As the President steps into the Oval Office itself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale, Emily, and the rest of the tour exit the Colonnade into the Visitor's Foyer as Donnie continues.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: Besides being a national landmark, the White House also happens to be a technological marvel. Underneath the West Wing is the Situation Room, the most sophisticated military command center in the history of warfare. And underneath the East Wing is the PEOC or Presidential Emergency Operations Center, the single most secure room on the planet. It's a vault built behind ten feet of concrete and steel capable of surviving a thermonuclear blast and equipped so the President and his staff could run the country from inside for six months without leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's the bowling alley?

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: (completely serious) Next to the Vault.
Finnerty, leaving the complex on foot. The kindly old Gat Guard smiles at her as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: GATE GUARD
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow, Carol! Finnerty turns west onto Pennsylvania Avenue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long hallway with dramatically vaulted arched ceilings that runs length of the Residence Building.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: We're now entering the Center Hall of the Residence. The President and First Lady live on the second and third floors, the Ground Floor and State Floor are dedicated to public rooms. To your left is the Library and to your right is the Vermeil Room, which houses the portraits of several of the most prominent First Lady's who have lived here. Pictures are actually permitted, so snap away. Emily goes to take pictures of the Vermeil Room. how happy she is.

dialogues.speaker: ATTRACTIVE WOMAN
dialogues.text: Yours?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Nah, I found her sulking around outside, thought if I brought her it'd make me look smart. Cale watches The woman smiles. Cute. Maybe the day isn't a total loss. She sees one of the paintings on the wall. One of a black White House. Donnie comes over.  27.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: Watercolor by George Munger. It's to commemorate the burning of the White House by the British in 1814.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: The White House burned down?

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: In the war of 1812. It practically had to be rebuilt from the ground up. A tugging on Cale's arm.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I think I need to avail myself of one of the 35 bathrooms in here.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: There's a ladies room upstairs, but I can't take the tour up there for another fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I'll take her. Where?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I can go by myself, John. I'm nota little girl. Cale looks at her. Sighs. Deciding.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Okay, but don't touch anything, don't wander off, and don't talk to anyone you're not supposed to.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I make no promises. She goes. Cale steps into the Vermeil Room to look around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Speaker's ASSISTANT pokes her head in.

dialogues.speaker: SPEAKER'S ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Mr. Speaker, I have the President calling for you. Raphelson snatches up his phone.  28.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Mr. President! I'm impressed with all your treaty signings you find time for little old me! INTERCUT with the Oval Office:

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: You do Jewish Mother's guilt very well, Eli.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: I just find it interesting that you would announce the signing of a major treaty with a sworn enemy of our country before, you know, mentioning it to anyone in Congress.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: It's the right thing to do, Eli. We're never gonna get a better chance at progress with Iran than right now.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Which would be wonderful if I didn't just have to take your word for it... We PAN out of the office and into the hall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Where we pick up the FIDGETY GUY from earlier walking past. Moving with purpose. On his way to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corridor opens into the enormous room beneath the fam CAPITOL ROTUNDA. Sunlight streams in. Various STATUES. Lincoln. Martin Luther King. Tourists snap photos. The Fidgety Man stops in front of one particular bronze statue. Looks at the name on the base. George Washington. The Fidgety Man checks his watch. It is 9:17 a.m. The man leans down and begins to untie his shoes. Then he removes them. Places them carefully on the floor. Then hi socks. A GUARD notices. This guy is undressing.  29.

dialogues.speaker: CAPITOL SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Uh, sir? The Man is now unbuttoning his shirt. Muttering to himsel

dialogues.speaker: CAPITOL SECURITY GUARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sir, you can't do that- The Guard stops. The man has unbuttoned his shirt. He is wearing a VEST OF PLASTIC EXPLOSIVES beneath it. The Guard stares at him, numb. The Fidgety Man raises his hand. Detonator in it. Exhales. Their eyes meet... And then the air is filled with fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A muffled WHOOMP! The whole building ROCKS. Raphelson is thrown sideways against his desk, still clutching the pho

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: (through phone) Eli, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: I'm fine, I- sir, I think there may have been an explosion here- He opens his door to the outer office - CHAOS. Glass and debris everywhere. Smoke pouring in from the hallway...

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty hears the explosion before she sees it. Car alar going off. In the distance - Smoke is rising from the Cap Rotunda. Finnerty begins to run towards it...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: (into phone) Eli? Bishop getting information from his earpiece:  30.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Mr. President, there's been an explosion at that Capitol, you need to hang up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: (into wrist) We are crashing the White House, repeat, the White House is crashed. Bishop takes the phone from Sawyer and hangs it up as the door opens and THREE AGENTS with SHOTGUNS suddenly come i the room. The DRESS MARINE behind him, wielding his M-16. The Marine bolts the door to the Oval Office as a KLAXON sounds throughout the complex...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale looks up at the siren as a SECRET SERVICE AGENT step into the room, blocking the exit.

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: Everybody please stay where you are. We're briefly restricting movement through the facility, shouldn't be more than a few minutes-

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: (tries to move past) My daughter's upstairs-

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir, no one moves until they lift the crash.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I'm an agent on the Speaker's detail-

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: Then you understand the protocol - nobody moves. Cale stares at him. A couple from Tennessee snaps his picture. This is very exciting.  31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raphelson hangs up the phone and looks to his Secret Serv Agent, who's talking on his own phone.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN
dialogues.text: The White House is crashed, sir!

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Where's the Vice President?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN
dialogues.text: In his office, I think-

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: (to his Assistant) Get him on the phone, tell him he needs to institute Continuity of Government-

dialogues.speaker: SPEAKER'S ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: What 's-

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: In the event of an attack, all principals in the line of succession are moved to Secondary Locations and a new communications band is put online-

dialogues.speaker: SPEAKER'S ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: I have the Vice President's Office, sir! (listens; then) He can't come to the phone, he was cut by some glass.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Glass? Tell him he needs to institute

dialogues.speaker: COG-
dialogues.text: ANOTHER EXPLOSION throws them sideways. Agent Kellerman looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, the building's on fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG SECRET SERVICE AGENT stands in the doorway to the theater among the Soundtek Workmen, enforcing the crash.  32.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG AGENT
dialogues.text: Don't worry, they do drills like this every other week. (smiles) Picked the wrong day to come to work here, huh? The man with the shaved head, STENZ, smiles back. Not nic

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: Guess so. And he raises a NAIL GUN and buries three bolts into the Agent's chest! The others move fast, professionals. They strip the man o his weapon and hand the gun to Stenz. Syncing their watch

dialogues.speaker: STENZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Armory, sixty seconds, go! -- And they spring out of the Theater into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running full tilt for the East Lobby. The Security Office at the end of the Colonnade looks up.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICER
dialogues.text: We're in a crash, you can't- BLAM-BLAM! Stenz shoots him twice in the head! His partne raises his walkie to his lips, screaming:

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICER 2
dialogues.text: Shots fired! Code Black, Code- BLAM! He goes down too as Stenz's right hand man HUMPHRIE scoops their weapons and they KICK through the side door the back stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily looks up at the shots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale automatically reaches for his hip to find his holste EMPTY. The Agent with Cale's tour shouting into his wrist

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: Repeat, please repeat!  33.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: (incredulous) He said shots fired, it's an AOP! He moves for the door but the Agent draws his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: Stay back!

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Goddammit, you need to get out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Armory Master pulls a SHOTGUN from the wall and racks it, spinning just in time for the door to be kicked open! Stenz comes in low, firing three rounds into the Armory Master's legs! The man crumples. Humphries hefts the ARC- WELDER and goes to work on the cage door. SPARKS FLY.

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds!

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: I have to wait for orders! We don't know what's happening- More GUNFIRE from upstairs. The Agent turns, distracted - And suddenly Cale is moving, bringing his fist up and tak the Agent down with a right cross! Grabs the Agent's gun. Checks the magazine, looking to Donnie:

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: My daughter, where'd you send her?

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: Upstairs, across the Hall second door on the left-

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Stay here! He bolts from the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Armory Cage door clanks the ground, and STENZ'S TEAM pours into the armory.  34. Quick cuts of them loading up - M-16's, MP-5's, shotguns, flash grenades...

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: Positions in two minutes, go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale, bounding up the stairs two at a time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Kellerman looks to Raphelson as he hears the news:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN
dialogues.text: We have gunfire in the White House, sir! Raphelson scoops up the phone and dials. Into it:

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: This is Speaker of the House Eli Raphelson, on behalf of the President of the United States I am instituting Continuity of Government...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bright shiny day. ROTORS spinning up. The Navy pilot tosses his pre-flight check and yanks back the stick as MARINE ONE rises into the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Hope looks up to Bishop and the President.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HOPE
dialogues.text: Marine One is three minutes out-

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: No, we have to get him to the PEOC!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HOPE
dialogues.text: They're in the damn building, we need to exfil-

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Mr. President, we don't know if they have surface to air missile capability, they could blow us out (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: of the sky! We get you to the Vault and their game is over! President Sawyer stares at for him a moment, then gives h a nod. The agents rack their shotguns. Bishop checks his Glock, safety off. Like a posse headed out for the OK Cor

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right everyone - stay low, stay close, shoot first, got it? On me! He kicks the Oval Office door open and he and his team pl out into the West Wing corridors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STAMPEDE of people pouring out the Main Entrance onto t North Portico. Cale reaches the top of the stairs, pushin through them, scanning their faces for his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Emily! Emily! He spies the bathroom door. Shoulders through it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale bursts in. No one. Checks the stalls. Nothing. She must have run. Shit. He barrels back out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale pushes out the door when -- MACHINE GUNFIRE nearly t his head off! One of Stenz's men on the far side of the hall! The rest the onlookers scream and scatter as Cale dives back insid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale ducks to the floor as bullets punch through the bath Ripping through the tiles, splintering the porcelain! Wat sprays from busted pipes in the sink. Slowly the ruined door is kicked open and Stenz's man RIT enters, holding an MP-5. Cale cowers on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Please, please don't kill me! I'm just with the tour!  36.

dialogues.speaker: RITTER
dialogues.text: You had a gun.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I didn't! I didn't have a gun! Please, I have a daughter, I- He raises the gun and shoots Ritter TWICE in the chest! Ritter pitches forward, pulling the trigger on his machin gun as he dies, and Cale manages to roll away through the bloody water as sinks and mirrors explode!

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus! Cale scoops up Ritter's rifle and stumbles for the door..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop and his team hustle the President through the West Wing offices, screaming:

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Move, move, make a hole! People dive out of the way as they come. Passing Secretar wiping hard drives, pouring water on keyboards, in some c taking FIRE AXES to their computers in attempt to data-du

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gate Guard, on the phone with the police as visitors pour out of the building across the South Lawn.

dialogues.speaker: GATE GUARD
dialogues.text: (into phone) No, send all available units now! The CLICK of pistol cocking behind him. He turns. Stenz, holding the Glock to his head.

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: One chance. Open the gate.

dialogues.speaker: GATE GUARD
dialogues.text: I can't- BLAM! Stenz steps over the man's body and keys in the cod The huge iron gate rumbles open and  37. TWO SEMI-TRUCKS hauling TRAILERS rumble through the gates and up the South Drive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sniper Team sees the trucks rolling up the drive. Sighting the lead driver, tapping his throat-mic:

dialogues.speaker: LEAD SNIPER
dialogues.text: This is Castle Keep, we have a breach at the North Entrance- The roof door bangs open behind him and they turn -- As Stenz's man MULCAHY bursts through, opening fire, OBLITERATING the White House Sniper Team in a hail of bul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trucks rumble up the North Drive unimpeded and pull t halt in front of the North Portico. The DRIVERS leap out and open up the back of the trailers where DOZENS of heavily armed MERCENARIES in body armor pour ou and swarm up the steps and into the White House... Behind them, a lone THIN MAN IN GLASSES steps out of the truck. Sucks on an inhaler and surveys the scene...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN
dialogues.text: There's a firefight on the roof of the White House and the North Entrance has been breached!

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Holy God...

dialogues.speaker: SPEAKER'S ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: (hanging up phone) Mr. Speaker, we have to go! The Capitol Rotunda's on fire! Off Raphelson's look of disbelief...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty sprinting flat-out. Holding her phone to her ear Ahead of her we see the unthinkable --  38. THE CAPITOL DOME is ENGULFED IN FLAMES. Windows explode outwards from the heat of the inferno within.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: (into phone) Do you have the Vice President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGENT MARCUS GRAHAM (30's) on the other end, as he hustle Jenna and VICE PRESIDENT ALVIN HAMMOND (60's) into a wait

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRAHAM
dialogues.text: We're putting him in the car now!

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: You don't stop for red lights, for police, and if something gets in your way, you drive through it!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRAHAM
dialogues.text: Is the President dead? Finnerty takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: We do not have his 20! Graham turns to the Driver.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRAHAM
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop and his team race the President through the now mo empty Center Hall of the Residence.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: (into radio) Eagle is thirty seconds from the Vault, we are coming in hot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE VAULT - the most secure room in the world. A ridiculously hi-tech room two floors below the East Win Chrome, glass, and LCD screens. The Watch Commander on th hard-line to Bishop:  39.

dialogues.speaker: WATCH COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Sir, we cannot open the door without authentication-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they run --

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: We're under attack, goddammit, open the door!

dialogues.speaker: WATCH COMMANDER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through radio) You know the rules, we need voice and retinal authentication from the President! Cale, coming down the stairs, seeing the President's Team

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Hey! The MARINE turns, seeing a Cale hefting the machine gun. OPENS UP with his M-16! Cale dives across the hall into the CHINA ROOM as four generations of White House China is obliterated around hi

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddammit, I'm on your side! But the President's already gone, down the East Colonnade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming up on DC, smoke from the Capitol rising into the s

dialogues.speaker: MARINE ONE PILOT
dialogues.text: Holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop and team hustle the President out of the back stai

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: They're right behind us, open the Vault! Around a corner, coming up on the HUGE VAULT DOOR...  40.

dialogues.speaker: WATCH COMMANDER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We still need authentication-

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: (grabs the radio) Open the goddamn door, Commander!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commander and his Lieutenant exchange a look. Definit the President. The men turn their keys together and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear HUGE TUMBLERS moving. As they clunk into place, t three foot thick steel door rumbles open revealing The P.E.O.C. Bishop stares at it, as the others rush past him inside. Hope looks at him, strangely.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HOPE
dialogues.text: We need to seal the Vault!

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Ted. And then Bishop raises his Sig-Sauer and shoots his frien in the chest! Holy shit! The other two Agents and the Marine raise their weapons, Bishop has the drop on them and takes them out too! Kills the Watch Commander and his Lieutenant as well! Swings his gun back around to the President when -- BULLE Rip into the wall just above Bishop's head!

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Run, Mr. President! Cale at the end of the hall, MP-5 blazing! Giving the President cover fire! Sawyer books down the hall to him! Cale grabs his wrist and drags him around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! As they run:

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Who are you?  41.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'm Secret Service, you're safe--oh shit! As Stenz emerges from the stairwell and OPENS FIRE! Cale yanks Sawyer back the way they came!

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Elevator!

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Where's an elevator? The President pulls Cale into a nook where an ELEVATOR DO sits. Stabbing the button relentlessly. Bishop coming dow one side of the hallway, Stenz the other. Boxed in... The elevator OPENS and -- Cale and Sawyer leap in, stabbi the door close button as Stenz sprints towards them, firi The doors slide shut.

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: It only goes up one floor! Bishop and Stenz sprint back down the corridor to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking the stairs two at a time and we TRACK with them ru as they burst out into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running flat out to the elevator doors, weapons up... The stop. Doors don't open. Bishop puts his ear to the door.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: They're going back down! Still tracking with them as they haul ass back to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop and Stenz, booking back to the elevator...  42. Too late. The elevator doors are open, the car empty. Cal and the President are gone. Stenz punches the wall.

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. (off his look) He got us into the PEOC, that's what counts. Button up the building and send out patrols, we will find him. As long as we fortify in the next five minutes they won't be able to get in here- Cut off by the sound of a CHOPPER approaching...

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Marine One. (into radio) Mulachy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulachy, drilling the last section of the base of a .50 C CANNON into the roof. The rotor blades growing louder...

dialogues.speaker: MULACHY
dialogues.text: (into radio) We're on it! Mulachy grins and moves behind the trigger of the .50 Cal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming in low over Pennsylvania Avenue, only fifty feet a the deck. We hear their radio chatter:

dialogues.speaker: MARINE ONE PILOT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Castle, this is Marine One, we are coming in for exfil on the South Lawn, coming in now, over! No response.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE ONE PILOT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Castle, I say again we-  43. As .50 CAL TRACERS streak from the Mulachy's roof cannon, tattooing the side of the Presidential Helicopter!

dialogues.speaker: MARINE ONE PILOT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Break left, break left! The chopper screams high and to the left as BULLETS ZANG it's armored body!

dialogues.speaker: MARINE ONE PILOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is Marine One, we are taking fire from Castle, repeat, we are taking fire from Castle! Smoke pours from the helicopter as it soars high above th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In all it's glory below. Now occupied by new residents.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE ONE PILOT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Castle has fallen, repeat, Castle has fallen. The White House is down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty sprints the last half-block to the ruined Capito dodging fire trucks, still on the phone with Graham.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sirens screaming, the VICE PRESIDENT'S MOTORCADE is flyin through Washington surface streets at 70 MPH! Graham has shout to be heard:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRAHAM
dialogues.text: We're two miles away from Andrews, the Vice President is secure!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Carol! Finnerty turns to see Kellerman loading Speaker Raphelson into a limousine. Kellerman motions her over.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty goes and slides into the front seat of the car..

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm with the Speaker, we're going to the Secondary Location!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN
dialogues.text: (into phone) Roger that!

dialogues.speaker: LEAD CAR DRIVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sir, there's a road blockage up ahead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver grips the wheel of the lead car of the Motorca Five blocks up - AN AMBULANCE is stopped across the intersection. Lights flashing.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD CAR DRIVER
dialogues.text: They're emergency vehicles!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRAHAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through radio) Agent, if they do not move, you drive through them! Four blocks away now...

dialogues.speaker: LEAD CAR DRIVER
dialogues.text: But, sir-

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRAHAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We may have already lost the President, this could be another attempt! You do not stop! Three blocks away. The Driver swallows.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD CAR DRIVER
dialogues.text: Roger that. Two blocks away. The Driver leans on the horn. He doesn't decrease speed. The Ambulance stays where it is...

dialogues.speaker: LEAD CAR DRIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispering) Move, please move, please...  45. One block. He's not moving. The Driver grips the wheel an closes his eyes. For God and country...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! The Lead SUV strikes the Ambulance doing 70! Both vehicles, ripped and twisted by the impact, flying off th pavement sideways and smashing into a STOREFRONT! Creating a HOLE in the intersection that the rest of the Vice President's Motorcade ROARS through!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security gate opens as the Motorcade tears through an out onto the TARMAC. Screeching to a halt next to

dialogues.speaker: AIR FORCE ONE
dialogues.text: Gleaming in the sun. All polished up and ready to go. Secret Service leaps out of the cars, scanning for threat Weapon out, Graham hustles the Vice President up the gang

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRAHAM
dialogues.text: Move, sir, move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham, the Vice President Jenna and the rest scramble ab the aircraft as we hear the engines powering up. As they buckle in, over the INTERCOM:

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DIX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Vice President, my name is Captain Leo Dix and I apologize in advance, but this is gonna be the hardest take-off you've ever felt. We're going to put this bird at 30,000 feet in 15 seconds, so do not be alarmed if you lose consciousness - Mikey, hit it. And the plane shoots forward at FULL THROTTLE! The passengers pinned back in their seats as the engines roar and Air Force One takes flight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One climbs up and away at a 55 DEGREE ANGLE fro the ground, becoming a speck in seconds...  46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roaring through the streets of DC. CNN plays on a small T We see a horrible sight - the CAPITOL DOME COLLAPSES INWA on itself from the heat inside. Flames rise from it.

dialogues.speaker: CNN NEWSCASTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh, My God... Oh, my God, I don't have the words... Raphelson swallows. Finnerty pulls a pistol from her hip. Checks the load, offers it to Raphelson.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: You know how to use one of these? (off his look) We don't know where they might hit next and this country needs need you alive, sir. Take it. Raphelson does. The limo takes a hard right, heading for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing. Dozens of MARINES in full body armor with assault rifles guard the gates. MILITARY TANKS rolling on the lawn to establish a hard perimeter. Raphelson's Motorcade roars through the gates into an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars pull to a halt and Raphelson, Finnerty, Kellerma and the rest spring out, heading for the front doors.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: We need the Head of the FAA to ground all air traffic over the Continental US and we need to close the borders-- Where's the director of Homeland Security?

dialogues.speaker: SPEAKER'S ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: He was at the White House.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Who's the Assistant Director?

dialogues.speaker: SPEAKER'S ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Wyck Halsey. Also at the White House.  47.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: I'm on with Agent Graham!

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: How are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: (listens; then) The VP just puked on Air Force One. As the Two Marines in front of them open the doors wide..

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: Mr. Speaker, welcome to the Pentagon. I'm Colonel Janowitz, I'll be taking you down to the bunker. Are these people with you?

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Yes, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily peeks around a corner to see a GROUP OF HOSTAGES he into the Center Hall. Some weeping and crying. HUMPHRIES and several Mercenaries standing guard. She backs away wh A HAND grabs her by the hair! STENZ. He drags her kicking and screaming out from her hiding place!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Get off me, asshole!

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That's not necessary. Bishop steps out from the East Wing. Stenz deposits Emily with the others, glaring at her. Bishop addresses them.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, I apologize, but this will not take long. If you bear with us and do what we say, you will not be harmed. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Humphries) Get a count, bring it to me. Search all of them then move them to the Situation Room. Any of my agents separate out, I don't want them causing dissent.

dialogues.speaker: HUMPHRIES
dialogues.text: You want me to...

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: I want you to tie them up and lock them in a closet and that's all. When you're done I want patrols organized, we need to do a room to room search of the complex.

dialogues.speaker: HUMPHRIES
dialogues.text: Why, are we missing something? Stenz gives him a look - not the time. Humphries nods and his men begin the count.

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: Where do you want to set up command?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Where do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small fires are being extinguished by mercenaries. Bishop and Stenz stride through until they reach

dialogues.speaker: THE OVAL OFFICE
dialogues.text: Bishop steps inside. A moment. Takes it all in.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: This'll do. Where's Tyler?

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: Still getting set up. Bishop grabs a radio. Into it:

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Mr. Tyler, we have a time frame yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TYLER, the man in glasses from the truck, supervises seve Mercenaries as they unpack huge crates of computer equipm and jack them in to the mainframe in the PEOC.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: (into radio) We're still plugging in power-bars down here, it's gonna be a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through radio) Call me when you have a timeline. Tyler puts down the radio and takes a seat at the central computer surveys the room. He smiles, deposits a JAR OF LOLLIPOPS next to the keyboard, and begins typing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Janowitz swipes his keycard and leads Raphelson a the others into the PENTAGON BUNKER, a bustling hi-tech Emergency Command Center.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: What do we know?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: At 9:17 a.m. an explosive device was detonated in the Capitol. We now believe this to have been a diversion, allowing a paramilitary team to seize control of the White House. They hold an unknown number of hostages, who may or may not include the President of the United States. We do not know their numbers, their capabilities, or their intentions.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: So we know nothing.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: We know we're down one Capitol and one White House. Raphelson shoots her a look. A LIEUTENANT looks up.  50.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUENENANT GAINES
dialogues.text: Sir, I have the Vice President from Air Force One.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Alvin, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICE PRESIDENT ALVIN HAMMOND (60's, grey) stands with his chief aide WALLACE (30's, oily) and several others. INTER

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: I'm fine, we're just a little shaken up. Do we know what happened yet?

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: We're just getting briefed now. (to Colonel Janowitz) Who's in command on the ground?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: Permission to speak freely? (off his nod) It's a shitshow. DC police is on scene, but FBI is trying to run it, plus Secret Service feels it should be their show since it was their building that got took.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: It was. (into speaker) Carol Finnerty, Secret Service, sir. We need one single command structure here.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: What we need is to send in the Army to retake the White House.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: You can't do that, sir. (off their looks) Posse Comitatus makes it illegal to deploy American troops on American soil.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: What about federalizing the National Guard?  51.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: Goes against a 200 year old law known as the Insurrection Act, plus the Vice President can't order it.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: (getting it) Because he's the Vice President.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: You do not hold the power of the Presidency, that is correct, sir. Make no mistake, we are ina Constitutional crisis - we have never lost a Chief Executive before. If the President were dead, that would be one thing, but missing? There's no constitutional remedy for that. Hammond's young aide WALLACE speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: WALLACE
dialogues.text: Yes, there is. We need to talk about invoking the 25th Amendment.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: You want to remove the President from power?

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: I don't want to do anything-

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) There are some practical issues with that, sir - The 25th would require a majority of the Cabinet to vote that President Sawyer was unfit to hold office in absentia - something that a). They may not do, and b). May not be possible, considering we do not have eyes on the Secretaries of State, Energy, Transportation, Education, and Homeland Security.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: You're saying a third of the President's cabinet may be dead?  52.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: That's exactly what I'm saying, sir.

dialogues.speaker: WALLACE
dialogues.text: We should get a head count of who's left.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Sir-

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: We can't be hamstrung by legalities, Eli. Delta Force is out of North Carolina, correct?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: Fayetteville, yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: How long would it take to get them to DC?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: We can have them on the ground here in forty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Then do it. We're going to take back what's ours. Wallace nods to him, happy with this play.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: There's another consideration...

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: We don't know what they want yet.

dialogues.speaker: WALLACE
dialogues.text: You want to negotiate with them?

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: I want to find out what they're after before we send a trident missile through the front door-

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: We've called them, right?  They turn to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Whoever did this. We've tried them on the phone by now, haven't we? 53. Janowitz's look says it all. Finnerty goes and snatches u the nearest phone.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Calling the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hostages are led down the stairs, through a low lit carpeted hallway to the SITUATION ROOM. Emily walks next Donnie the Tour Guide, who is entranced.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: Wow...

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: They never let us in here on the tour. Emily stares at him. He's having a ball...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop sits behind the President's desk. Stenz

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: Hostage count is seventy-one. Humphries has them secure in the SitRoom. Bishop nods as he picks up his radio.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Good. (into radio) Tyler, where are you? comes over.  54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler chewing on a lollipop, hands flying over his keyboa One of the others holds the radio to his mouth as he spea

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: It's getting a little gnarly down here... Without the President's Passcode, we're looking at about 45 more minutes.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through radio) 45 minutes I can handle, call me when you're close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop puts the radio back down.

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: Switchboard says they have an incoming call. One of yours.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: It's about time. He looks down at the phone. Line one lit up. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: This Agent Carol Finnerty, to whom am I speaking?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: It's me, Carol.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Martin! Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: I'm fine. You should have called already, we've had the building for fifteen minutes. A beat.  55.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: We?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: I'm assuming you're recording this, so I'll make it easy for you - my name is Martin James Bishop and my men currently control the White House and 71 hostages within. The following political prisoners are to be released - Gerry Burke, Gregory Aoki, Sadaam Al- Hafra, Vikram Govindan, Michael Mayer-

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Will, what are you-

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: -I'm not going through these names again, Carol - Efrem Krieger, Arneau Galezowski, and Saadi Soudavar. You have one hour to effect these releases or we begin killing hostages, it's that simple. Finnerty takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Not your concern. Clock's ticking. About to hang up the phone when:

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Is the President alive?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: I want proof of life. Stenz raises an eyebrow at Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: One hour, or I execute him in front of cameras on the South Lawn. He hangs up the phone.  56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raphelson and the others stare at Finnerty lowers the pho reeling. Takes a breath. Centers herself and

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: We need all of Bishop's financial and medical records immediately, he's got a wife Muriel and three kids in Georgetown, I want them brought here now. Agent Kellerman nods and goes.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: I have Thanksgiving at their house every year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop looks up at Stenz.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Find the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The First Family's personal quarters. Far away from the chaos going on two floors below. Cale steps into the room, gun up. Scanning. Tasteful decorations. Thick carpet, plush furniture. And empty.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: We're clear. President Sawyer enters behind him.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right now they're getting situated, but that won't last. They'll be coming for us. (checks his clip) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: What?  57.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: We only have three bullets. Do you keep any weapons in here?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: There are usually two dress marines with M-16's standing outside that door, so no, I didn't see the need.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: What about knives in the kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Through there. The President points to a door. Cale raises the gun.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Stay behind me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pristine. Pot racks and expensive ranges. Warming drawers A beautiful kitchen. Cale enters. No one there.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Clear. Sawyer comes in behind him and goes for the knife block o the island.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: How long have you been in the Secret Service?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Six months.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Well, technically six months Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: But you've done this before?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Oh, sure, this is like my third White House terrorist take-over attack this month.  58. Cale spies the phone on the wall. Goes to pick it up...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
