dialogues.text: Not that I don't like our chances with three bullets and a kitchen knife, but I thought you might want to call your good friends at Seal Team Six and see if they wanted to swing by and help.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: You pick up that line, anyone at the switchboard will know we're up here.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Good point. Do you have a cell phone?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: I have a better idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President opens up his bedside drawer and withdraws a sleek SATELLITE PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Satphone with a built in alpha- scrambler. No one can tap in.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Why do you have this next to your bed?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: So I can make private calls to the man I'm seeing. Cale blinks.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kidding. Sheryl wanted to be able to call her mother without the NSA listening in. So, who do we call?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: You don't know?  59.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: I haven't placed a phone call for myself in over two years.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: They didn't give you like a special Presidential dial-in number in case of emergencies?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: (dry ) . No, they told me my Secret Service protection would handle that. Touche. Cale stares at the phone. Has an idea. Fishes out a card from his pocket...

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I know who we're calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruising altitude. Shaken, Jenna sits in her seat watchin the VICE PRESIDENT and others walks down the aisle to the CONFERENCE ROOM down the hall. Jenna raises a soda to her mouth with a shaky hand... Her cell phone rings. She jumps, spilling the soda. Answers.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale with the satphone. INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Jenna, it's John Cale, I'm with the Pres-

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: This really isn't a good time. And she HANGS UP. Cale stares at the phone in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Close friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenna, about to take another sip when the phone RINGS AGA She spills again. Answers, about to yell at him but:  60.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Jenna, don't hang up! I'm calling from inside the White House, I have the President with me!

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: That's not funny, John.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Jenna, I'm not kid- Sawyer takes the phone from Cale.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Jenna, hi, this is James Sawyer, listen, I've just spent the last ten minutes getting shot at, so if you could connect me to whatever command and control structure we have left in this country, I would really appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: (flustered) Sir! Yes, sir, I- uh, hold on! She bolts from her seat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. The President looks to Cale.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: We're on hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vice President, getting a quiet pep-talk from his Chi of Staff.

dialogues.speaker: WALLACE
dialogues.text: This is your moment, sir. The country is looking for a leader. It's your time to step up- Interrupted as Jenna bursts in, out of breath!

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: I told you we weren't to be disturbed-  61.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: (holds up her phone) The President of the United States just called my cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop's radio crackles. It's EVERETT, the head of one of the sweep teams:

dialogues.speaker: EVERETT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We just finished a sweep of the State Floor, no sign of them. Bishop thinks. Into the radio:

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: If someone broke into your house, where would you run and hide? (realizes) They're in the Residence. Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raphelson and Finnerty gather around the viewscreen as Je puts the call through.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Hello? Mr. President?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: I'm here, Alvin. We're okay.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: We?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: I'm with a Secret Service Agent, I'm going to put him on the line. Handing the phone over to

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Hello, this is Agent John Cale.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Cale?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Miss Finnerty?  62.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: John, what are you doing in there?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Long story, sir. They've taken the building and are holding hostages. We evaded them so far, but that won't last, so not to put too fine a point on it, but this is the part where you come in here and save us.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: We're working on several different scenarios, but in the meantime, you need to get the President out. Can you get to the basement? Cale looks to Sawyer, who nods.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Good. There's a series of tunnels that lead out to the street. JFK used them to sneak Marilyn in.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I thought those were a myth.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Actually, they're not.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Donnie's gonna be pissed...

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: You get to the basement, and I'll lead you to the tunnels.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: And when I get him out, you're gonna come in and get the hostages, right? Finnerty and Raphelson exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They have my daughter. Tell me you have a plan to save her. Finnerty takes a breath.  63.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: We will get to her, but you have to get the President to safety. This is the most important thing you will ever do.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: You want me to leave my child?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: I want you to do your sworn duty and protect the President of the United States! DING! The Elevator ARRIVING on the Third Floor! Sawyer's eyes go wide as he motions to the hallway - they're comin Cale hangs up on her.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Cale? Cale! She's just met with static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door creaks open and CHEN and EVERETT creep into the room, rifles up. They scan the room - seemingly empty.

dialogues.speaker: EVERETT
dialogues.text: Mr. President? No response.

dialogues.speaker: EVERETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have no desire to harm you or your companion. Please come quietly. Chen points to the bed - Cale's blood spattered SHOE poki out from the far side. He gives Everett a hand signal, yo go right, I go left.

dialogues.speaker: EVERETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The sooner you come with us, the sooner this will be over. He springs around the bed weapon up to find... Just the shoe sitting there. Everett blinks. A decoy. And then the wardrobe door flies open behind him and  64. CALE leaps out, knife in hand, stabbing him in the back! Everett screams and pulls the trigger and the room is fil with GUNFIRE! Chen goes down, riddled with bullets! Everett charges backwards, trying to throw Cale off! Smas him back through the door, charging across the West Sitti Hall and into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everett slams Cale back against the island and rips the k out of his back, spinning to face him! Cale grabs a pan and hurls it at Everett's head, who duck and slashes, catching Cale across the forearm!

dialogues.speaker: EVERETT
dialogues.text: Ranger choke-hold? You one of those Army pussies? He slashes again as Cale hurls a pot at him!

dialogues.speaker: EVERETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We used to use faggots like you for target practice! Cale jumps up and brings the whole fucking pot rack down Everett's head! Everett reeling, Cale grabs a cutting boa and whacks Everett across the face! Everett drops the knife and they grapple, but Everett's getting the upper hand...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Freeze! They both look - in the doorway, the President of the Uni States, holding the gun on them. Everett doesn't freeze. In fact, he smiles and continues beat the ever loving shit out of Cale. Sawyer, trying to get a clear line of sight...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What- what do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Shoot him! Sawyer's finger tightens on the trigger, but Everett gets his arm around Cale's neck and hauls him in front of him, using him like a human shield...  65.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait not, now! Don't shoot now! Sawyer moving the gun around, trying to get a clear shot. Cale rams his head back into Everett's nose - SNAP! Evere screams and Cale dives clear.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now! BLAM-BLAM-BLAM! Sawyer shoots and Everett is blown backwa off his feet! He lands in a heap, dead. Cale collapses against the counter, gasping. Sawyer lower the gun. Breathing hard. Numb. They both sink to the floo Water sprays up form the sink, where a bullet struck it. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Three bullets...? Sawyer looks over at him.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: You had to use all three bullets?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: I saved your life and you're giving me notes? Cale pulls himself to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: We have to conserve ammo...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: I was trying to conserve people. You're welcome, by the way. Cale kneels down next to Everett's body, dialing the satp

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: (into satphone) We have two dead bad guys up here.  66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raphelson and the others look up as Cale's voice comes th the speaker. Finnerty rushes to grab the phone.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Describe them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale rolls Everett's body over, searching him.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Both Americans, well trained, proficient with small arms, hand to hand combat and... oh, shit. He's rolled up Everett's sleeve to expose a tattoo of a Screaming Eagle.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Cale? But Cale HANGS UP the phone, severing the connection. Loo at the President, quietly. Concerned.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Sir, this is a Special Forces tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: The army's doing this?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Maybe. They were taking orders from your Head of Secret Service, right?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: It's a coup de'tat... Cale games it out in his head...

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: No. If they wanted you dead, you'd be dead. This is something else. Sawyer nods. Looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: I didn't know they had your daughter. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pause) If I thought turning myself over to them would save her, I'd do it. But we both know that's not how these people work. Cale stops, noticing BLOOD on Sawyer's shirt. Alarmed, he leans down and begins patting him down.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Are you hit?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: (searching for a wound) Have you been shot, sir?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: (pushes him away) No! No, it's the other guy's blood from the bedroom- I got splattered. Cale steps back, relieved. Looks at Sawyer. The President of the United States, in his care.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I'm going to get you out of here. He extends a hand to Sawyer and pulls him to his feet. Gr Everett's MP-5 and checks the load.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have to get to the basement. They head for the West Sitting Hall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty, talking to the Communications Officer.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Get him back on the line! Agent Kellerman re-enters the Bunker and pulls her aside.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN
dialogues.text: Muriel Bishop left the country four days ago, bought a one way ticket to Venezuela. Non-extradition.  68.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Pull phone records, see if the Venezuelan government was in contact with either of them in the last two years. Loop in NSA, they might have had a tap on Bishop's phone.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN
dialogues.text: There's something else. He hands her a sheet of paper. Finnerty scans it, then ta a deep breath. Turns to address the room and the viewscre

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Mr. Vice President, Mr. Speaker, we have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Another one?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: The list of prisoners Bishop wants released; they're not all in the US. Gerry Burke is former Sein Fein and is being held in London, Galezowski is a Basque separatist, he's in France-

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sure all these countries would cooperate if-

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Samir Al-Hafra's being held in Iran. State Department's already reached out, but they won't let him go.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: What did Al-Hafra do?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Tried to assassinate their President.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: There's a lot of that going around.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: It doesn't make sense. Why these prisoners? What do they have in common? A Basque separatist, an Irish revolutionary--what's Krieger?  69.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN
dialogues.text: Former MOSAAD.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: None of these guys are high value targets, we've got bigger names sitting in Guantanamo right now.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: You think it's a diversion.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: I think it's something.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Tell State to try again. Linked or not, we either need to release these people or kick in the door in the next 43 minutes, otherwise Bishop's going to start executing hostages on national TV.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: If the Iranians won't give up Al- Hafra, maybe we go get him. They look to the VP's viewscreen.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Nimitz is in the Gulf, they have a detachment of SEALS onboard.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: If we send men into Iran to get Al- Hafra, we're committing an act of war. Do you really want that on our plate this morning too?

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: You don't think we're at war? Take a look around you. Come on Eli, Iran's our enemy, you said it yourself-

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Just because I don't want to sign a treaty with them doesn't mean I think it's a good idea to invade! We need to hold this together.  70.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Colonel, I want the SEALS briefed and prepped for an assault on the prison if we give the word.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: Respectfully, sir, only the President can give that order-

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: The President is behind enemy lines and compromised. I'm assembling the cabinet now to invoke the 25th. Raphelson stares at him, in shock.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: The President's still alive... You won't get the votes...

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Wallace assures me I will. We've already done the head count. (to Colonel Janowitz) It'll take about ten more minutes to get everyone together. How long till Delta Force arrives?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: They'll be here in fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: By the time they land, I'll be able to give them the go order. (to Raphelson) Get onboard, Eli. He cuts the connection. Raphelson looks to Finnerty. Not good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler's radio crackles:

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How's it coming, Mr. Tyler? Tyler, fingers flying on the keyboard. He curses, spits o his lollipop and grabs the walkie. INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: I'm having a firewall problem...  71.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: You know what happens when they catch you trying to hack the government? They hire you. I'm working against the best black-hats of the last twenty years-

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: I'm going to need you to come to the point here.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: I'm going to need more time, another two hours at least-

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Shit. Tyler takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: It would be a lot easier if you brought me that passcode.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: So noted. Everett, did you find anything in the residence? Everett? No response. Bishop frowns. Tyler, seeing something on hi monitor. One of the elevators is MOVING.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: I have movement. Central elevator, coming down from the residence-

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: It's them. Can you stop it between floors?

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: (typing) Absolutely. Halted between two and three.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Lock it up, then send a team to-- actually scratch that. Stenz, would you be so kind as to bring me the President of the United States?  72. Stenz hefts his M4 rifle with a grin and heads for the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stenz leads a team of three men towards the elevator bank

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: (into radio) We're in the central lobby. Bring it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler punches in a few more keystrokes and onscreen the elevator begins moving again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stenz hears the machinery moving and the elevator car com to a halt on their floor. Weapons up, ready to for a firefight. The doors ding and slide open to reveal... The car is empty. Stenz keys his radio:

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: It's a decoy! They're still upstairs! He books for the stairwell, his team following. As they bound upstairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grimy and disgusting. Everything covered with grease. Cal and Sawyer are shimmying down a narrow service ladder to base of the shaft.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I'm surprised nobody put this on the tour.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: I'll look into it. They reach the recessed bottom of the shaft. Standing amo the elevator machinery, the bottom floor of the White Hou at their chin level. Cale dials Finnerty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty snatches up the phone. INTERCUT:  73.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Relatively. We're at the base of the elevator shaft.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: You mean in the elevator?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Not so much, no. Finnerty checks the blueprints.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay, you need to pry the doors open and get across the hall to the stairwell - that'll lead you down to the catacombs.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: How are we going to open the door? The President holds up a butcher knife from upstairs. Cal smiles and takes it. Pries open the elevator doors a crac He STOPS. Footsteps on the hall. Someone rushing past pushing a dolly loaded with wooden crates. The stamp on t side says "SURFACE TO AIR"...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: That can't be good. Cale waits for the sound to recede, then slides open the doors the rest of the way. Climbing out into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low lit hall, filled with boxes. This is the Storage Le Cale, covered in grease. He pulls the similarly filthy President up and they move across the hallway to the stai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stenz and his team sprint into the Main Room. Nothing. They find Chen dead in the bedroom and Everett down in th kitchen. Stenz looks back to the elevator. Realizing:

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: Goddammit, they're in the shaft! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: STENZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (runs for the door) Whoever this guy is, he's starting to piss me off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale and the President descend a spiral staircase.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Did you know about this?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: I just knew about the tunnel from the pool house that leads back to the Residence. Truman put it in because he didn't want to be photographed in his swim trunks walking back to the house. They reach a door at the bottom of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: (into satphone) We're at the bottom of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That's the entrance to the catacombs. Take the second tunnel on your right, follow it all the way out. We'll be waiting. Cale takes the pistol out and hands it to the President.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I'm not going with you.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I can't leave her. You get out, you send the Marines back in to get me and my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: You have my word. They shake. The President pushes through the door...  75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dingy, clearly built during the bomb-shelter era. The President steps forward to a chickenwire gate that leads the tunnels. About to open when he notices -- PLASTIC EXPLOSIVES wired to the gate door. Beeping transmitters and wires everywhere. He stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Cale!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty snatches up the ringing phone.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: You on your way? INTERCUT with Cale and the President staring at the bomb:

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: The entrance to the tunnel has been wired with explosives.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: What's it look like?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Like a shit-ton of explosives. Here. He snaps a photo of it with the satphone and sends it. An image of the device pops up on Finnerty's viewscreen.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, don't touch that. (to Colonel Janowitz) I need an explosives expert in here now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stenz and his team, racing back down the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale and the President hear the footsteps approaching.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: They're coming...  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty, desperately flipping through White House bluepr

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: We have to move, where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Hold on-

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I can't hold on, which way!

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: I don't know, I- Just run! Cale and the President BOLT back into the stairwell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burst out of the stairwell into the low-lit corridor

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Central staircase should be fifty yards in front of you. Delta's inbound, ten minutes!

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: They'll have us by then! We need a location! The President grabs his arm. Says one word.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Stagecoach.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: (into radio) I know where we're going, Finnerty. We're getting out of here. They reach the central staircase, as behind them, the ele DINGS open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raphelson leans over to her.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: The cabinet's assembling right now...  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they sprint up the stairs:

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through satphone) Cale, if you don't get him out of there in the next five minutes, he may not be the President anymore.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: We're doing the best we can, but thanks for the added pressure! Sawyer pulls him to the left as a BURST OF GUNFIRE comes from below! Stenz, coming for them. Cale and the Presiden bolt off the stairs onto the STATE FLOOR Stenz keys his r

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: Contact in the Main Stairwell, they're on the State Floor headed East!

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: East? Why would they- (realizing) Roland, they're coming to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop's man ROLAND, guarding a door.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: (into radio) Roger that, I'll be- Bullets punch through him! Cale and the President! They leap over his body and shoulder through the door into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRESIDENT'S FULL MOTORCADE parked under the building. Row upon row of black Yukons and Escalades. Cale and the President bolt the door shut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop, hearing Roland go down.  78.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Shit! All sweep teams, converge on the Motor Pool! He grabs his own weapon and races out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets rip through the Motor Pool door - Stenz on the ot side, trying to get through!

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Where are the keys?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: In the cage! Sawyer begins tossing furniture in front of the door as C races for the metal cage on the far side of the garage. H finds a padlock on it and shoots it off! Rushing inside. Dozens of keychains hang from hooks. Cale, about to ask t President which one he should grab when he sees it -- A keychain with the Presidential Seal on it and these wor Ground Force One. Cale smiles and snatches it up.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Got them! The President abandons the door and they both run to the side of the garage where in all its glory sits

dialogues.speaker: STAGECOACH
dialogues.text: The Presidential Limousine. An eight ton military armored modified Cadillac CTS, sitting on a Chevy Topkick wheelba Each door weighs as much as a cabin door on a 747. A hermetic HISS and CA-CHUNK as the doors UNLOCK. Cale ge in the driver's side and the President runs for the rear.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you getting in the back for?!

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Sorry, force of habit! He slides into the passenger seat, and they closed the ca doors as the Motor Pool door crashes inwards!  79. Stenz, running at them, EMPTYING a FULL CLIP into the fiv inch thick BALLISTIC GLASS in front of Cale's face! The bullets just zang off! Cale points to his ear making the universal "I can't hear you" gesture. As Stenz reloads, Cale slams the keys into the ignition a the Beast roars to life...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How do we open the garage door- Cale hits the gas. The Beast peels out, SMASHING THROUGH the closed Motor Pool doors out onto the East Entrance dr Bishop sprints into the Motor Pool just in time to see th peel out!

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: We're going after them! They grab keys and climb into the Yukon XL's to give chas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beast screeches around a corner, roaring up the East Drive for the South Gate as the Yukons peel out of the ga Sawyer, seeing them coming.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Shit, they're in the heavy-weapon follow cars!

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: What do you mean 'heavy weapon'? On cue, the Lead Yukon's sunroof retracts and manned .30 caliber M-134D DILLAN ROTATING MINI-GUN rises up out of t car! (Seriously, these cars really exist). The Gunner pulls the trigger and the cannon springs to li bullets tearing chunks out of pavement around the Beast!

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?! Cale yanks the wheel to the left, taking the chase off-ro and ONTO THE SOUTH LAWN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vice President sits, addressing the assembled members the CABINET on viewscreen.  80.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen of the cabinet, thank you for joining me today. It with a heavy heart that- Wallace enters, interrupting him.

dialogues.speaker: WALLACE
dialogues.text: Sir, you need to see this... He grabs a remote, clicking the TV on to CNN -- LIVE FEED of The Beast tearing across the South Lawn of t White House, being pursued by three Black SUVs follow car each with roof mounted machine gun cannons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale tears through the Kennedy Garden, swerving...

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Can we crash the fence?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: It's dual hardened steel and twelve feet high, so no! Until they have an exit, they're trapped on the White Hou Grounds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raphelson and the others, watching the whole thing on TV slack-jawed.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: We'll get a welding crew out there-

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: There's no time for that! Cale swerves to dodge another hail of bullets and SMASHES through the President's daughter's SWINGSET!

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Get someone to blow a hole in it!  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three blocks up from the White House. TWO DC PATROLMEN si in their huge ARMORED RIOT-CONTROL VEHICLE on crowd contr Watching with the rest of the world.

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: They're trapped in there... His partner looks at him. They know what they have to do.

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's put some of this goddamn Homeland Security budget to use! He fires up the siren and the Riot Vehicle lurches forwar tearing across the sidewalk towards the White House...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roar of an engine. The Guard looks up, then raises hi M4 to fire, but the Riot-Control Vehicle SMASHES THROUGH Gate and Guard House, FLATTENING HIM! The cops whoop, victorious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fist-sized CHUNKS OF CONCRETE are blown out of the White House Fountain, as the Beast roars past it, being pounded the MINI-GUNS!

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through the radio) There's a breach at the North Gate! Go! Cale yanks the wheel right, the car catching air as it decimates the White House PUTTING GREEN...

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Stay with him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale, trying to shake Bishop and figure out a way to the North Side of the grounds.  82.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: What's the quickest way to the North Gate? The President points. Dead ahead, the White House TENNIS COURT. Cale hits the gas... They chunk down onto the clay surface of the Tennis Court tearing across it, snapping through the net at center cou Up a grass embankment on the other side, catching air, slamming back down in time to smash through several sets PICNIC TABLES! Cale swerves left around a grove of trees, the SUVs following, MINI-GUNS obliterating the foliage! Up a hill, catching air again, then screeching onto the President's BASKETBALL COURT, barely missing the basket, which the Second SUV slams into, flipping over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulachy, sighting the destruction at the North Entrance through his scope...

dialogues.speaker: MULACHY
dialogues.text: (into radio) They're going to make it to the Gate.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Use the ATR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Patrolmen seeing the Beast coming towards them:

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: Come on, you can make it! Come on- WHOOMP! An ANTI-TANK ROUND goes through the windshield, obliterating the Patrolmen, BLOWING THE VEHICLE APART!

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulachy retrains the huge gun on The Beast and PULLS THE TRIGGER...  83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale swerves in time and the First Lady's vegetable garde is blown to smithereens! Cale zigs again as another anti- tank round UPROOTS A TREE! Total destruction!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulcahy sights them one last time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The anti-tank round SLAMS into the Beast's left rear axle blasting the tire off and LIFTING the car INTO THE AIR. I hangs there for a heart-stopping moment, before FALLING. Coming down on its roof with an enormous splash into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrified gasps. Onscreen, the President's Limo sinking..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upside down. Through the windshield, we see the bottom of the pool. Cale lies on the roof. The President hangs abov him, still buckled in. Smoke filling the cabin...

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Wikipedia lies. Sawyer releases his seatbelt and tumbles down onto the ro beside him.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay? The President nods, coughing. Looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: You can't let them take me alive. A sitting President cannot become aa hostage... you understand? Cale nods. Checks his pistol. Grasps the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Deep breath! They both take one and Cale opens the door - WATER RUSHIN in to the car...  84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale and Sawyer surface sputtering in the shallow end. Dragging each other out of the water as the SUV's pull to halt. Bishop, Stenz, and the others stepping out.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Freeze!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching the LIVE FEED from CNN - a helicopter shot. Bish men have the President and Cale dead to rights.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. Oh, my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale and the President stand dripping in the morning sun. Bishop holds his gun on them. Shouts across to Cale:

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Who are you! Cale looks up. Breathing hard. Shouts back:

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I was on the tour! Bishop bursts out laughing. Too much. Then:

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Put the guns down! There's nowhere else to run! Cale and the President look at each other. A moment betwe them. Butch and Sundance. And then Cale raises his gun an OPENS FIRE. Suddenly everyone is firing, and Cale and the President r to the POOLHOUSE behind them as one of Bishop's men jumps the MINI-GUN and --

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! -- PULLS THE TRIGGER, the thing spinning to life, GRINDIN BULLETS through the poolhouse, and Bishop screams at him stop, as the structure is ripped to swiss cheese and ther must be a gasline in there because as Bishop runs towards  85. The Poolhouse ERUPTS INTO a FIREBALL. The whole building consumed the explosion, Bishop blown backwards off his fe

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People gathered below the giant screen watch in horror as the structure the President ran into becomes an inferno. Some weeping. Others embrace. A terrible moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop, streaked with ash. He slowly gets to his feet, staring at the burning wreckage. Nothing could have survi

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Get me Finnerty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty pushing back tears herself when

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN
dialogues.text: Bishop's on the line for you. She swallows and takes the phone.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch. You swore to protect him-

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: The President of the United States is dead. You have 22 minutes. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. The Vice President stares at the shocked faces o the cabinet onscreen. Everyone shaken. He speaks softly:  86.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen... considering what we just witnessed, I don't think a vote is necessary, do you? Heads are shaken. Several murmured "no's". Wallace turns to Jenna, who is also crying.

dialogues.speaker: WALLACE
dialogues.text: Jenna, could you please find us a bible? TIMECUT TO - Hammond's palm being placed on a bible. As w hear his voice, we begin CUTTING AROUND the country to im of people watching the destruction at the WHITE HOUSE:

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I, Alvin Hammond, do solemnly swear that I will faithfully execute the Office of President of the United States...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three sleek BLACKHAWK HELICOPTERS cutting through the restricted airspace, coming in for a landing on the roof the Pentagon...

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And will to the best of my ability, preserve, protect, and defend the Constitution of the United States... The choppers touch down and COMMANDER PAUL CAMERON (hands 30's) steps off, in full battle armor, flanked by Lieuten

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...-So help me God. As Cameron and his men descend into the building

dialogues.speaker: CNN NEWSCASTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Word coming now that Vice President Alvin Hammond has been sworn in as the 47th President of the United States...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellerman slaps down a medical file on the table.  87.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN
dialogues.text: Medical records from Bishop's doctor in McLean. He's got a tumor in his head the size of a golf ball. Diagnosed six weeks ago, inoperable. (off their looks) There's more. Forensic accounting found this. 50 million was transferred into Muriel Bishop's account 12 hours ago. They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: That kind of money means this is state sponsored. China, North Korea, Iran-

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: How does it benefit another country to destabilize a nuclear superpower?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN
dialogues.text: Maybe they weren't thinking that far ahead. Colonel Janowitz hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: Delta's here. The doors to the Bunker open and CAMERON AND HIS LIEUTENA stride in, snapping off a salute to Raphelson.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: Mr. Speaker, I'm Commander Paul Cameron, Delta Force - I'm ready to brief on the incursion plan?

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Is this something you threw together in the last half hour?

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: No, sir, this is long standing. We've run drills on this.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: You've run drills on assaulting the White House?  88.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: Ma'am, we've run drills on everything. Initially we thought we'd go in through the tunnels, but you say they've been wired? A VOICE from behind them speaks up: TED (0.S. Yes, but I-I-I- may have a solution to that. They all turn to see a SHORT BESPECTACLED MAN in schlumpy attire clutching a raft of papers standing there. Nervous

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I'm Ted.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Ted?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Theodore Lasky. I- I- you said you needed an explosives expert in here? (off their looks) I'm from Homeland, I come up with different ways to blow things up.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: How do you get a job like that, Ted?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: You really don't want to know. But I think the devices in the tunnels can be defeated.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: You think.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Hypothetically, yes.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: Hypothetical doesn't cut it. Bishop's going to start executing hostages in 18 minutes, so we're going to go in over the top. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (points to blueprints) We're going to land two Blackhawks on the North and South Lawn here and here, make them have to defend both sides. Our guess is Command and Control is located somewhere in the West Wing, so we make that the choke point.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: What about the approach?

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: Satellite shows they only have anti- tank capabilities on the roof, no surface to air missiles, nothing that can lock on to an aircraft. We go in fast and hard, hose down the roof, then make it a ground war. From the Communications Desk:

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: I have the President of the United States on the line? They all look up at this, surprised. Then the VICE PRESIDENT's image pops up on the viewscreen.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Commander.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: I'd first like to take a moment of silence for President Sawyer. He was a true patriot and a good friend-

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: With all due respect, sir, we don't have time for a moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Then let me ask this; why is this option better than scrambling a couple of F-15s out of Andrews and putting a few sidewinders up Bishop's ass? Raphelson blinks.  90.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: You want to call in an air strike on the White House?

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: I want an option that doesn't risk the lives of American fighting men and women.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: And what about the hostages, sir? What are they, collateral damage?

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: They're dead anyway if this fails. We level the White House with an air strike, not only will we end this, but we will show the world that we will go to any lengths to combat terrorism, both foreign and domestic.

dialogues.speaker: WALLACE
dialogues.text: You would be sending a very clear message, sir...

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Alvy, please, don't do this-

dialogues.speaker: WALLACE
dialogues.text: Mr. Speaker, you are addressing the President of the United States.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: Mr. President? This is Commander Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Yes, Commander?

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: I don't want to write off any Americans in there just yet. Trust me, sir. We'll get your house back for you. Silence as Hammond considers this.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Mission's a go, Commander.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.  91. Cameron races out of the room, Finnerty following...

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Colonel, get on the phone to Andrews, I want three F-15s fueled and ready to launch if this goes wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty follows Cameron to his chopper as the rotor blad spin up. Cameron, to his men:

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: Assault on Castle is a go, flight time to the target is six minutes! He looks at Finnerty, questioning. She struggles with it.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: I know Martin Bishop!

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: He'll be in the Oval Office! You get close enough, mini-gun should be able to cut through the glass! Good luck! She offers Cameron a hand and he shakes it. She steps bac as the Blackhawks lift up into the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and musty. Deep beneath the earth. Two figures come into view. Cale, supporting a limping President Sawyer. Both very much alive.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Tunnel under the pool house. God bless Harry Truman. The President chuckles. It turns into a cough.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any chance this leads out of here?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: I think just back to the Residence... I gotta stop for a sec.  92. Cale lowers the President down into a sitting position. Sawyer coughs again into his fist. Looks at his hand. Blo

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's not good, is it? Cale opens Sawyer's jacket, searching in. Finds the sourc of the problem - a hunk of SHRAPNEL the size of a large p sticks out of the President's side.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Shit. We're gonna have to take that out.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: You go to medical school in the last ten minutes and forget to tell me? Cale kneels down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: It's not near a major artery, but if it gets infected you'll die, and that would look really bad on my resume. I'm gonna remove it and clean the wound, okay?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Okay. (pause) I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Under the circumstances, I'd say that's the correct response.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Your bedside manner sucks, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Relax, I've done this before.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Afghanistan. The President looks at him.  93.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I'm not. You ready?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Tell me when you're gonna pull it out, okay?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Wait, no don't. I don't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: So you just want me to do it.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: No. No, tell me.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: All right, I'm gonna pull it out on the count of three. One... He yanks out the shrapnel. Blood. Sawyer SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Goddammit! You're fired! You are so goddamn fired! SHIT!

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I have to clean it now. Don't pass out.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Okay, solid point. His hands dip below frame and he begins to clean the woun

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Talk to me, okay? Take my mind off it...

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: What do you want to hear?  Oops. 94.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Baseball scores, I don't know, anything, your daughter, tell me about your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Her name is Emily. She's ten. She loves you. A lot. She begged me to vote for you.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: You didn't vote for me?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Well, you know, you wanted to raise taxes-

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Only on the richest one percent of the--goddammit, you didn't vote for me?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: What can I say? She's smarter than I am.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Clearly.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don't know when that happened. Half the time it makes me proud, the other half it drives me nuts. But she's smarter. And she hates me.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: I'm sure she doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I'm sure she does. She thinks I left her. When I went overseas. She's right. I did. She was six years old and then poof! No Dad.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: You did what you had to.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: People say that. Doesn't change anything, though, does it? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pause) And if she makes it out and we don't, the last thing she's gonna see of me is video of trying to get you out. Leaving her behind. Again.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: That's not how this ends. He means it. Cale smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: When they're young, they run up to you and hug you, and shout "Daddy!" And then one day it just stops. No one tells you that. I'd give anything to have that hug one more time.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: You know what my daughter Paula wants for her fifteenth birthday? A belly button ring. Who the hell is equipped to deal with that? Cale laughs. Looking at Sawyer.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Daughters.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Yeah... Cale leans back, work finished.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Surprisingly okay.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Told you I knew what I was doing. (digs out satphone) I'm gonna call in, let them know we're not dead. He dials the phone.  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty looks up at the ringing phone in disbelief. Look at the caller ID. Could only be one person. Answering it:

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Cale?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Alive and kicking. We're in the tunnels under the pool house.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: And the President?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: He's hurt, but he'll be okay. Cheering in the Pentagon Bunker.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: That great news! Stay put, the cavalry's coming!

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Delta?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: They're in the air, should be hitting the Residence in four minutes. Cale smiles fades.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: In the air? No, no, it's gotta be a ground assault- Bishop's got surface to air missiles, if they come in by air, it'll be a turkey shoot!

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Satellite showed the roof was clear-

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: He's keeping them in the basement so you can't see- you have to call them off!  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COLUMN of BLACKHAWKS sweep across the Potomac. Through the open doors we see the soldiers checking their weapons going through pre-battle rituals. Land coming up...

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: All right, hug the deck, we go in low and quiet! The Blackhawks drop down to fifty feet above the ground rushing past below, swooping between buildings...

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Time to target is three minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty curses and throws aside the radio.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: They've gone dark for the assault, there's no way to raise them!

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through phone) There's nothing we can do! Cale, realizing those men are going to die. He looks to t President.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Sir...?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Go. Cale grabs his assault rifle and RUNS. Booking down the tunnel, back towards the White House...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop re-entering, talking into his radio to his men:

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: They'11 be coming now, so move the SAMs to the roof. Mulchay, be ready.  98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulchay, scanning the horizon with his scope...

dialogues.speaker: MULACHY
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop's men roll DOLLIES stacked with SURFACE-TO-AIR MIS crates onto elevators. Men rush to their assigned posts. Like a submarine preparing for battle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guards checking their weapons. Emily hears the commot in the corridors. Whispering to Donnie:

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What's going on? He shakes his head, no idea.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You think it's my Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale, the Dad in question, running flat-out. Screaming in the cell-phone:

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: If I can get to the roof before they fire the missiles, I might be able to stop them! Coming up to the chicken-wire gate with the EXPLOSIVES wi to it! He can't go through without setting it off!

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit! I'm gonna need some help here with the bomb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty spins around, scanning the room.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Ted? Ted! No sign of him.  99.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where's Ted?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN
dialogues.text: I think he went to the bathroom...

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Now?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weaving through the streets of DC...

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: Two minutes to Castle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty, save for a man sitting in the far stall. We hear pages turning. Whistling. Serenity. Suddenly, Kellerman bursts in. Kicks in the stall door revealing TED, pants around his ankles, reading a copy of Touch magazine. He grabs Ted and hauls him out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stenz emerges onto the roof with the crates of SAMs. Mulc raises a crowbar and cracks the first box open, revealing SHOULDER-MOUNT LAUNCHER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty hustles Ted into a chair and hands him an earpie to speak to Cale with. INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: John Cale? This is Ted Lasky, I work at Homeland Security-

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: He doesn't care where you work, Ted!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Okay, there are three possible ways for you to disarm this particular device. Do you by any chance have an engineering degree?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Okay, two possible ways for you to disarm this particular device. Do you see the yellow wire?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: (reaches for it) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Don't touch it. It's the decoy. What about the green wire? Cale looks.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: There are six green wires.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Are some of them a lighter green than others?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: There are six green wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of helicopters approaching. As Stenz loads a missile into Mulcahy's launcher...

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Okay, you need to pull the green wires sequentially, starting from the left, moving to the right. Don't let more than two seconds pass between pulling each one. Are you ready? Cale exhales. Puts his hand over the first green wire.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Ready.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Go. Wait. Cale pulls his hand away.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, what?  101.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Is there writing on the side of the device? A company name?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: (reading) "Snyder".

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: This is Snyder? That changes everything...

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: What do I do, Ted?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Well, don't touch the green wires, that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One minute out. Cameron pops in a stick of gum and crosse himself...

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Do you see a power source, like a battery? Cale squints.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Unplug it. A bomb is like any other electrical device, if you deprive it of its power source, it ceases to function.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: And it won't explode?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Probably not.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: What if you're wrong?  102.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Then hopefully the sound of me being blown into a million pieces will distract them. Finnerty, if I die? She knows before he even asks.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: I'll get her out. Cale swallows. Good enough for him. He reaches forward, grabs the battery wire, and yanks it out... No explosion. Cale pulls the bomb off the door, stuffs it in his satchel, and is through the gate, running for the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thundering down Constitution Avenue, turning North toward the White House...

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: Twenty seconds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulchay, hefting the launcher...

dialogues.speaker: MULACHY
dialogues.text: Come to Papa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale, shooting two guards on the First Floor landing! Bounding up the stairs, racing for the roof...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Blackhawks crest into view, charging straight at t Residence. The Launcher BEEPS...

dialogues.speaker: MULACHY
dialogues.text: We have missile lock.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Fire.  103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the choppers come in over 15th Street, Humphries FIRES A MISSILE streaks out of the launcher, screams through th air across the length of the South Lawn and enters the Le Blackhawk's cockpit at 150 MPH! The AIRCRAFT BLOWS APART spectacularly, the burning husk the cabin smashing down into the White House Fountain, cracking the concrete and obliterating the water feature!

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: Holy shit, break left, break left!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilots yank hard on the sticks and the Second and Thi Blackhawks split apart, going left and right respectively Stenz slides another missile into Mulachy's launcher, as tracks the Second Blackhawk across the sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cockpit's instrument panel goes red and an ALARM SOUN

dialogues.speaker: BLACKHAWK PILOT
dialogues.text: They've got missile lock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulchay pulls the trigger and the missile fires! The Blackhawk Pilot tries to take evasive action, but the mis SLAMS into rear rotor, ripping the whole tail section off

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: Auto-rotate, auto-rotate, we are going dow- WHAM! The chopper slams nose-first into the South Lawn, crushing the cockpit and pilots! ROTOR BLADES WHIPPING into the dirt, SHEERING OFF, sendin razor sharp debris slicing through the White House fence into the buildings across the street!  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stenz reloads Humphries as the Last Blackhawk breaks hugh and right over the White House... The launcher BEEPS. They have tone. Missile lock. About to pull the trigger. The roof door bangs open. They look. John Cale! He FIRES A BURST through Mulcahy's chest, blow him off his feet! The sniper crumples, dropping the launc Cale pivots and looses a burst at Stenz, who is already running away, SHOOTING BACK at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swinging back around towards the White House...

dialogues.speaker: BLACKHAWK PILOT
dialogues.text: (to Gunner) Take them out! The Gunner jumps on the deck mounted .50 cal and pulls th trigger and UNLOADS on the roof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale dives away from the door as it's ripped to swiss-che Trying to take cover as the Gunner VENTILATES THE ROOF! Bullets punching through everything! The Blackhawk swings in high, the remaining Delta members getting ready to fast-rope down. The Gunner pauses for th to get into position, giving Cale time to glance up and s STENZ. Hoisting the fallen launcher, angling it straight at the belly of the chopper and

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: No! Stenz fires. The missile flies and the last Blackhawk BLO APART directly above them! Cale and Stenz both roll away, trying to dodge the sizzling chunks of debris that rain d The FLAMING TAIL SECTION crunches down through the Third Floor Roof into the Master Bedroom! The cockpit misses th building completely and smashes down onto the concrete dr in front of the North Portico four stories below. And finally, blessed silence.  105. Cale's eyes blink open. Amazed to be alive. Covered in soot, grease, and oil. He tries to get to his feet... WHAM! A bloody fist crashes into his face! Stenz. Alive. Pissed. He smashes Cale's head into the gravel rooftop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron pulls himself and several of his men from the wreckage of the Second Blackhawk on the South Lawn. All o them ragged and bloody. He tries to rally them.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER CAMERON
dialogues.text: We're kicking in the front door! Come on! The others bellow back at him in the affirmative and what remains of the Delta Force charges up the South Lawn towa the entrance to the West Wing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop stares out the window. Watching the Last Charge of the Delta Force. He raises the radio to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Finish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four of Bishop's men step out onto the South Portico Balc and level their weapons at Delta. A raised firing positio The high ground. They unload. And the Rose Garden becomes a killing field. Cameron watches his men to the left and right of him fall slow-mo. Bullets rip through him. Still he pushes forward Trying to make it to the man in the window of the Oval Of Cordite and rose petals swirl in the air around him. He falls to his knees. Pistol in hand. Firing at Bishop. The bullets barely nick the glass in front of his face. They hold each other's gaze for a moment more... Fresh gunfire from above finishes it. Cameron goes face down among the roses. Dead ten feet from the White House.  106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four stories above, Stenz hurls Cale into the side of a chimney! Beating the shit out of him! Cale, gasping, pick up a chunk of brick as Stenz lumbers towards him... Cale turns and swings, connecting with his shoulder! Sten screams and Cale tackles him, catching him off balance, sending both men careening over the side of the roof and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GLASSED-IN GREENHOUSE on the Third Floor Promenade, jus to the right of the North Portico. Connected to the Residence, it's where the First Lady grows her herbs. Cale and Stenz tumble down onto the GREENHOUSE ROOF. Squeaking and sliding on the glass, as they struggle -- The glass begins to SPIDER-WEB with cracks. They freeze. Looking at one another. The glass, stretching, groaning.. BOOM. It shatters. Cale and Stenz plummet into the greenhouse proper, smashing down onto herb beds! Cale is first, grabbing a piece of glass and slashing at Stenz! On him, punching him, finally getting the upper hand!

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: You like that? Stenz crashes Cale back into a shelf of pots, as the door flies open and Bishop's Man MOTTS opens fire and Cale scr as a bullet tears a chunk out of his shoulder!

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: Give it to me! Stenz grabs the rifle and wheels around to finish Cale, w seeing no other option HURLS HIMSELF THROUGH THE GLASS! Cale smashes outwards into space, legs kicking as he leap

dialogues.speaker: OFF THE THIRD FLOOR BALCONY
dialogues.text: Stenz screams in frustration and runs to the edge, FIRING DOWN into the foliage below! But it's no use. Cale is gone.  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TVs still playing the horrible aftermath of the Black attack. Finnerty snatches up a ringing phone.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop, on the other end. Pissed.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: That was stupid. INTERCUT - Finnerty taken aback, not who she expected.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Martin-

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: You knew I'd be ready for an attack but you sent them in anyway. You made me kill them-

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: I didn't make you do anything. I know about the cancer. That stops him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nobody else had to die, Martin. He looks at the bodies in the Rose Garden...

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: I didn't want them too. But because of you, now I have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Retaliate. Hr hangs up the phone and grabs the walkie.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tyler, do you have his location?  108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lollipop in mouth, fingers flying, INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Locked in.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Bring him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful mountain range. Sun shines. Birds chirp. SUPERIMPOSE - NORAD - North American Aerospace Air Defens Center, Cheyenne Mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole Operations Center carved into the mountainside. Dozens of TECHS man terminals. One Tech blinks in disbeli To his WATCH COMMANDER:

dialogues.speaker: NORAD TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Sir, my weapons system is coming online! It's being accessed remotely, I can't- Jesus Christ, it's targeting!

dialogues.speaker: WATCH COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Ch (sprinting over) What?

dialogues.speaker: NORAD TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: It's firing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE BALLISTIC MISSILES roar out of a mountaintop silo a climb into the sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole place in an uproar.

dialogues.speaker: NORAD TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: We have three away! Non-nuclear ballistic missiles-

dialogues.speaker: WATCH COMMANDER
dialogues.text: What's the target?  109.

dialogues.speaker: NORAD TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Uhhhhh, aircraft over Ohio, looks to be a modified 747 Heavy- (realizing) Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soaring over Ohio, accompanied by fighter escorts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Dix looks up as KLAXONS SOUND!

dialogues.speaker: CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: Holy shit, we have incoming! Three missiles, out of the southeast going super-sonic-

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DIX
dialogues.text: I have the stick! He grabs the stick as the plane bucks out of auto-pilot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vice President and others thrown to the floor as Dix puts the aircraft into a dive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raphelson and the others, seeing the chaos on screen...

dialogues.speaker: F-15 PILOT
dialogues.text: They're going for heat signatures, we're going to try and draw them off! He and the other pilot break off as the missiles streak i One missile pulls away from the others, following the hea signature of the F-15! The pilot climbing as fast as he can, pulling 3G's, but - THOOM! The F-15 FIREBALLS!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DIX
dialogues.text: Two left! Deploying chaff!  110. He stabs a button and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hatch on the tail opens and METALIZED GLASS fibers SPEW out of the back of the plane! Spitting tons of the stuff, hoping to distract the missile guidance system. And it works! One of the missiles streaks left past the plane and out over Lake Abram!

dialogues.speaker: CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: One to go!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DIX
dialogues.text: We're gonna out-climb the son of a bitch! He hauls back on the stick, taking the plane to a seventy degree climb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People tumble through the cabin like dice, screaming and crying as they try and claw their way to their seats! Jenna weeping as she buckles herself in, her eyes finding Agent Graham across from her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final missile zeroing in on them, as they tear into t upper atmosphere, the missile's nose cone icing over...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DIX
dialogues.text: We dive and hit the chaff, he flies right past! He slams the stick forward, levelling the plane, smashes down the chaff button and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaff blasts out of the back as the plane goes into a CRA DIVE! The missile miraculously keeps climbing!  111.

dialogues.speaker: CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: You did it! He pumps his fist as Captain Dix whoops for joy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE MORE MISSILES streak out of the silo into the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Co-pilot stares at the radar in disbelief. Five more coming. No way out.

dialogues.speaker: CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DIX
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Ladies and Gentlemen, I'm so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People screaming, confused. Jenna looks at Graham. Knows this is it. Her hand finds his. Their fingers entwined... Fire blossoms as the first missile strikes Air Force One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raphelson, Finnerty, and the others staring at the Vice President's viewscreen. No image. Just STATIC. Colonel Janowitz speaks into a phone and then hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: (softly) We have confirmation of ground impact. Silence. Raphelson turns away. Finnerty looks for somethi to punch. No one knows what to say. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: We're going to need to swear you in, sir. It takes Raphelson a moment to realize she's looking at h  112.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: No. If President Sawyer's still alive in there-

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. Executive power passed to the Vice President when he was sworn in, which means... the office now passes to you.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... The phone rings. Finnerty punches it through on speaker.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Did you get my message?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Name calling aside, our timetable still stands. You have... (checks his watch) Six minutes to our deadline.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: What do you want these prisoners for?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Not your concern-

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this? Raphelson puts a hand on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: We need more time, Mr. Bishop. We can't release all the prisoners in six minutes, one them's in Iran, for Chrissakes!

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Well, then you better go get him.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: It's not that simple-  113.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: It is exactly that simple. In fact, let me show you how simple it is - you're originally from Denver, Colorado, is that right Mr. Speaker? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: If I don't have confirmation in the next six minutes that you are liberating Sadaam Al-Hafra from his prison, in addition to executing hostages here, I will fire a missile on downtown Denver. Sound fair? Raphelson clenching his fists so hard they're shaking...

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Six minutes, sir. Bishop breaks the connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interrupted as STENZ strides into the Oval, cut and blood

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: He's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: The tourist. He killed Mulchay and Konner on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Alone? Stenz nods. Bishop thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe he's not. Who comes on a tour alone? A beat. Bishop grabs the walkie.  114.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tyler, can you stream me video of everyone who came in for the tour this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Raphelson exhales. Looks up at the others.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: I know what it looks like. But I swear to you, we're not beaten yet. Colonel, get me the base commander at Andrews. Finnerty looks up, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: General Pierce is on the line, sir.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: General, this is Eli Raphelson. The Vice President had instructed you to fuel three fully loaded F-15s with a target package for the White House, is that correct?

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL PIECRE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: I want you to launch those planes, General.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL PIECRE
dialogues.text: Roger that, sir. Tower, you are clear to launch. We hear him giving more orders as Finnerty looks at Raphe stunned.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Mr. Speaker-

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: We have to end this, Carol. We give him more time, who knows how many more weapons systems they can control?  115.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: And the White House?

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Look what we've already been through today. (hand on her shoulder) Our country is stronger than one house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE F-15's fire up their thrusters and streak off from tarmac into the morning air, headed towards Washington DC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop and Stenz, scrolling through security footage...

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: There. Bishop stops it - the IMAGE OF CALE AND EMILY coming in, Emily shrugging off Cale's embrace. Father and daughter.

dialogues.speaker: STENZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know her. We have her in the SitRoom.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Bring her here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily sits with the Tour Guide. A small commotion near th front of the room. Emily looks up to see Stenz standing i the doorway. He points to her.

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: Come on pretty, we got a date. The others shrink away from him.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: What are you going to do to her? Stenz ignores this. Moves for Emily. Donnie steps between them, using every last bit of courage he has.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're going to have to go through me.  116. Stenz pauses. Seems to consider this for a moment. Then pulls out his pistol and SHOOTS Donnie in the stomach! Emily screams. Donnie falls. Stenz grabs Emily and drags her from the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserted hallways. Stenz pulls Emily along, on their way the Oval Office.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: You're going to go to jail for that.

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: Yeah? Who's gonna make me? Emily looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Who did that to your face? Pissed, Stenz pushes her along...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: Birds are in the air, sir! Time to target is 15 minutes! He sets the wall clock to count it down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop's watch beeps. The deadline up. He picks up the phone. INTERCUT with the Pentagon:

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Your time is up, gentlemen. Finnerty slides Raphelson a note "NEED TO BUY TIME". Raphelson takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: We'll give you what you want. (to Colonel Janowitz) Tell the SEAL Commander the Iranian incursion is a go. As he says this, he shakes his head at Janowitz - don't d it. Finnerty, playing along:  117.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: But sir, the Peace Accord-

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: That's an order! Bishop smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Very good. We'll wait for confirmation the prisoners have been freed.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: And then?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Then you will receive further instructions. You made the right choice, Mr. President. They hear Bishop break the connection. Pan up to the airstrike countdown clock on the wall. 14 MINUTES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bishop hangs up, Stenz enters with Emily. She looks around. The actual Oval Office. And a man sitting behind the Resolute Desk. Not the President. He smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
