dialogues.text: Hi there, sweetie. Let's have a conversation about you and your Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room in the basement where all of the floral arrangem are put together. Deserted. Flowers lay strewn about the different tables. The sound of GLASS breaking. Cale slides in through a window. Cradling his machine gun Torn and bloody. He limps over to one of the tables. Find a roll of packing tape. Tries to wrap it around the bulle wound in his shoulder. Stifles a scream as he does so. He takes a breath. Gathering himself. Moves to the door. Looks out into the hall. The stairwell down to the cataco down to the left. He moves for it... The White house PUBLIC ADDRESS system crackles on:  118.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. Cale! His voice echoes throughout the complex. Cale blinks - Bi knows his name.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You've proved to be a quite a nuisance this morning, so I wanted to let you know that I'm sitting here with someone who wants to say hello. Say hello, Sweetie!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello. Cale's face - Oh, Jesus, no.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Would you like to tell your father what I'm holding in my hand?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A gun. Oh God. Cale begins to sprint-limp through the hallway. Doesn't even know where he's going, just trying to get to the source of the voices...

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Is there anything you'd like to say to him before we do this?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They're holding forty of us in the Situation Room-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop claps a hand over Emily's mouth. Gives her a smile

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Not like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale looking at his cheap White House Map, desperately scanning it for the location to the Situation Room...

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Mr. Cale, I'm going to count to three. Wherever you are, I advise you to start trying to signal one of my men, because if they don't have you in their custody by the time I reach three, I'm going to shoot your little girl in the stomach. One... Cale can't believe it, it's all happening too fast...

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Two... Cale opens his mouth to scream, but

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, over here! Here! Footsteps go running towards the voice - what the hell?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: ...Three. A beat. Bishop looks Emily in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guess Daddy doesn't love you after all. Stenz raises his weapon when the radio squawks:

dialogues.speaker: MOTTS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through radio) We have him, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: (into radio) Cale?

dialogues.speaker: MOTTS
dialogues.text: No, sir. The President. Motts and another man stand with PRESIDENT SAWYER who has just surrendered himself. INTERCUT:  120.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Well, that changes things. Get him up here. They march Sawyer up the center stairs. Cale watches from around the corner. He could shoot, but what if he hit Saw What if that made them kill Emily? He watches them go, powerless. Curses. Pulls out the satphone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnerty snatches up the phone. INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: They have the President.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Cale, you have to get out of there. Help's not coming.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Didn't you hear what I said-

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: They killed the Vice President. An air strike's been called in on the White House.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: No-

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Yes. You have to go. Cale takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: They still have hostages. They still have Emily.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Then you have 12 minutes to figure out a way to get them out. Cale doesn't respond. He's staring across the hall at the painting of the White House in 1814...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motts leads President Sawyer into his own Oval Office. He stops in the door to see Bishop sitting behind his desk.  121. Emily sits in the corner, guarded by Stenz. Motts offers a pistol to Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: MOTTS
dialogues.text: He had this on him. Bishop takes the gun, tsk-tsking him.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Whatever happened to the pen is mightier than the sword? Sawyer looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: As President of the United States, I want you to know that this comes with the full weight, power, and authority of my office - Fuck you. Bishop smiles. President Sawyer looks to Emily.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay? She gives him a tight nod.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: I made sure your family wasn't here for this. So now I want you to do something for me. Sit. Sawyer doesn't move. Motts kicks him in the back of the knee, driving Sawyer into a chair.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Each President is given a twelve digit passcode, it changes every three months. I need yours.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: It won't get you access to the weapons systems-

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: It's not the weapons systems I'm after, sir. Sawyer stares at him. Realizing:  122.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: You're data-farming? That's what this is all about?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: You say that like it's some minor goal. This building contains more critical information onsite than any other structure in the world. Defense allocations, national security protocols, troop locations and movements in three separate ongoing wars. Do you even comprehend what those secrets are worth? We'll open the bidding at 100 billion. I think the Chinese will ultimately take it, but the Russians will give them a run for their money. (off his look) What? Did you think we were here for you? Now. The passcode. The President can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: You're did all this for money?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: I have a tumor in my head that's supposed to kill me before Arbor Day. Who's going to take care of my family, Mr. President? You?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: And your solution is to throw away decades of service to this country?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Maybe spending the last twenty-five years seeing what vain petty people you are all helped. This country's sole operating principal for the last two hundred years has been "Get as much as you can for yourself and screw the other guy." So after twenty- five years, that's what I'm doing, Mr. President. I'm getting mine. The American Way.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: What about your kids? What will they think when you're gone?  123.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Money's the most important thing in this country, right? Well, they're about to have a lot of it. (levels the gun) Now. The passcode.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: You know I can't. Bishop sighs and points the gun at Emily.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Do we really have to do this again?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: If I give it to you, our enemies will know everything.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Just the ones who can pay.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Our country will be over.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: There comes a day when all empires must fall, Mr. President. (cocks the gun) I'm going to count to three...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: (to Emily) I can't give it to him, you understand- WHAP! Stenz pistol-whips the President in the mouth! He spits blood. Emily looks at him. Locks eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: One...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: (to Emily) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Two... Emily closes her eyes...  124. A KLAXON goes off. Sounding throughout the complex.

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler, staring at his screen in disbelief. Into the radio

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: I have thermal alarms going off in two- wait, no, three different locations! Third floor kitchen, second floor hall, second floor East Bedroom-

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (to President Sawyer) What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: It means your father just set fire to the White House. (into radio) Send teams to put them out, we can't let the building go up yet-

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: We don't have teams anymore, sir!

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Then peel men off the Situation Room, this building's a two hundred year old tinderbox! A new alarm wails.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through radio) Fourth Alarm! Fire in the Lincoln Bedroom! As if on cue, the SPRINKLERS go off above them! Drenching everyone in the Oval Office. Bishop, furious, tosses Stenz and M4 rifle.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Kill him.  125.

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: With pleasure. He turns and bolts for the room. Bishop, into the walkie:

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Shut those off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Janowitz, in contact with the F-15's...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: Six minutes to target, sir!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT KELLERMAN
dialogues.text: Sir, you need to see this... He turns the sound up on CNN - which now shows smoke pour out of the Second and Third floor of the White House!

dialogues.speaker: CNN NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: Smoke began pouring from the structure minutes ago, leading us to believe that the upper floors of the White House are in fact on fire... Finnerty looks to Raphelson.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: It's Cale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the Situation Room opens and TWO MEN barrel o of it, running to the stairs, turning the corner to find Cale, who opens up with the machine gun! The men fall! Cale races towards the Sit Room door. Humphries steps out FIRING, and Cale dives to the ground, spraying back! A waterford crystal vase explodes in the hallway as Cale rolls sideways, strafing the door! Humphries goes down screaming, bullets punching through his legs! Cale is up and runs into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes through the hostages, finding the wounded Tour Guide being tended to on the floor.  126.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE THE GUIDE
dialogues.text: They took her to the Oval Office! Cale looks around to the others.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: There's an air strike coming! Get everyone out of here now! Total panic now. People screaming, pushing through doors! Cale running with them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raphelson, eyes glued to the television.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Something's happening in there! We have to give him more time!

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: Four minutes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The F-15'S STREAK towards Washington...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As people pour out of the SitRoom, Cale runs for the West stairs, bounding up them, to the First Floor. Rounding a corner into WHAM! A bloody fist to the face again! Stenz. Cale's gun goes sprawling. Stenz sends another rib cracking punch to his gut, sending him hurtling back into the Press Room!

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: I'm gonna enjoy this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop raises his gun and BLAM! SHOOTS the President in t leg! Sawyer screams, doubling over!  127.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: That's the femoral artery. Unless I stop it, you're going to bleed out in that chair. What's the code?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON CNN - The hostages now STREAMING out of the building a the North and South Lawns!

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: Three minutes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: (to Raphelson) Give the man a chance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMASH! Cale is HURLED through the double glass doors by t Briefing Room out onto the Colonnade! Landing in a bloody heap. Stenz, advancing on him...

dialogues.speaker: STENZ
dialogues.text: Your daughter says you're going to take me to jail. So are you? Stenz KICKS HIM. Cale grunts as the force of it propels h into a column. Stenz pulls a knife.

dialogues.speaker: STENZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm gonna carve my fucking name into your chest. He leans down as Cale rolls and smashes both feet into St left knee! The knee BUCKLES and Stenz screams, falling! Cale yanks something from his satchel and slams it into Stenz's chest. Stenz looks - it's the BOMB from the tunne His eyes lock with Cale.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: No jail for you. He pulls all six green wires and RUNS. Stenz screams a se before he BLOWS APART...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON CNN - the ENTIRE WEST COLONNADE EXPLODES! Chunks of pi and roof are blasted out as far as the street!  128.

dialogues.speaker: CNN NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Inside the Bunker, Finnerty gasps. Behind her is Ted.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Looks like somebody touched the green wire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop, Sawyer, and Emily are thrown to the ground as the building rocks on its foundations!

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Emily, run! The little girl bolts for the door! Motts smacks her in t back of the head with his pistol, sending her sprawling! raises it to kill --

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! Wait! I'1l give you the code! Motts looks at Bishop, who goes to his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: Now, or she dies. The President takes a breath and begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale stares at the twisted flaming destruction between hi and the West Wing - no way to get to Emily now. All he's got left is his pistol. Pops the clip. Looks.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Three bullets. Snaps it back. Mind racing.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Think, goddammit, think! His eyes fall onto a very particular doorway that he went through once before in the film...  129.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: For the love of God, sir, you have to stop this! He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: What if it's a trick?
He doubles over as a coughing fit overtakes him. Spitting up more blood.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: What's the last number! Tell me! The President tries to speak, but all that comes out is a wheeze. Bishop curses and runs over to him. Kneeling down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The last number. Now. Sawyer mumbling something...

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? He leans down, putting his ear to the President's mouth..

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: I said, I'm sticking with the pen. And he pulls the treaty signing PEN from his coat and STA BISHOP in the neck with it! Bishop screams, rearing back against the Resolute Desk cl at his neck. As Motts levels his gun to kill Emily and th President both, we hear an ENGINE ROAR. Motts looks up in time to see A BLACK SUV - Ripping through the Rose Garden, coming str for them. Cale at the wheel. We barely has time to process what's about to happen befo  130. The SUV smashes THROUGH THE FRONT WINDOW and INTO THE OVA OFFICE! Bishop diving out of the way, the desk obliterate as it slams into Motts and drives him into the far wall, crushing him! Water gushes from burst pipes and sparks shoot from socke Part of the roof collapses onto the SUV!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole room, screaming at Raphelson:

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: 45 seconds to target! Pilots are removing firing triggers!

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Somebody just drove a goddamn car into the Oval Office, don't do this!

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: Sir, I need a go/no go for payload delivery!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bishop tears the pen from his neck and swings his arms ou wildly, grabbing Emily up as Cale collapses out of the ve into the ruined office of the Chief Executive! Bishop presses the gun to Emily's head, as Cale brings hi own pistol up, training it on him! Silence. Mexican stand-off. Neither man moving. In the distance, the roar of jet engines approaching... Bishop opens his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: BISHOP
dialogues.text: I'm going to count to- BLAM-BLAM-BLAM! Cale pulls the trigger. Bishop pitches back over, holes in his chest.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Three. Cale falls to his knees as Emily runs to him. Wrapping he arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Daddy!  131. Cale hugs her tight right back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roaring over the Potomac, coming up on the White House...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: 10 seconds, go/no go! Raphelson closes his eyes. God forgive him.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale turns to the hole in the wall to see the jets approaching. Shoving Emily towards it. Too weak to follow

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Run, honey! She looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go, I'm right behind you! Emily looks up at the jets, and suddenly knows what's abo to happen. She scoops up the fallen American Flag on the office floor and RUNS. Cale collapses to the floor. Watching her go. At least she'll be safe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PILOT arming the weapons systems, finger moving to th trigger...

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Dropping in 5, 4, 3... He squints as he sees A LITTLE GIRL on the White House lawn. Twirling, doing a flag girl routine. Red, white, and blue fluttering in the breeze.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Abort, abort, abort!  132.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The F-15's break formation, screaming over the structure! Weapons intact.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: We have negative impact, repeat, no weapons released on target. Raphelson opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: What? Janowitz listening to the phone, then:

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JANOWITZ
dialogues.text: Sir, we are getting multiple reports in now that the hostages have reached the police barricades and are saying that Castle has been retaken. I... (pause; listens) The White House is secure. The entire room BURSTS INTO CHEERS! Hugs and tears! Raphelson, stunned. Finnerty squeezes his hand. It's over

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily steps back into the wreckage of the Oval to find he father propped up against the remains of the desk. He smi at her. She shrugs, a little self conscious.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: You wanted to see my flag twirling...

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: You were beautiful, baby. You saved us.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: You came back for me.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Always. She hugs him again. Coughing from the other side of the room. They look. Sawyer, watching them. Smiling. Coughs.  133.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Did you drive a car through my office?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: We have doors, you know.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: A lot more now. The President laughs.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Gonna take awhile to fix this place up.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: You can come stay with us.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: (looking at her) Us?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Yeah. He hugs her close. Outside on the lawn, various emergency vehicles gather and choppers land.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Medic! We need a medic in here! A MEDICAL TEAM rushes in. Cale and Emily step back as the swarm the President. Tasking his vitals, starting an IV.. Cale takes an offered blanket and wraps it around Emily's shoulders and they step out onto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire helicopters hover, dousing the top two floors of the White House with fire-retardent foam. Dozens of news chop circle. Marines set a perimeter around the building. Cale and Emily walk through the fray, almost forgotten. Until

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Cale!  134. Cale turns to see Finnerty step off a helicopter. Their eyes meet. So different than they were a few hours ago. Smiling as she approaches. For a moment they don't even know what to say. Then Finne steps forward and hugs him. Places a small kiss on his ch

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: So, does he have the job? Finnerty looks over to the gurney carrying the President of the Oval, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: That depends. Does he have any references? Behind her, Cale sees Raphelson step off a chopper. Flank by MILITARY AIDES, he marches grim faced towards the Whit House.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: He could have turned back the air strike and didn't. He's taking it hard. And... She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: And what?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: We just found out the fifty million in Bishop's account came from an Iranian cut-out. This was state sponsored terrorism. Cale watches Raphelson step through the ruined facade int what's left of the Oval Office.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: What's he going to do?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Retaliate.  135.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raphelson marches through the ruined halls. Stepping thro glass and debris, over fallen bodies.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Somebody clean those up. Headed for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty, now that the terrorists are gone. Raphelson steps over Humphries body as he enters. Exhales.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: God forgive us for what we are about to do. He looks to the NAVAL AIDE carrying the Nuclear Football.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: NAVAL AIDE
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Our country has been attacked by a rogue nuclear state, I have discussed it with my advisors and this is going to be our course of response; my Presidential Authorization Code is 9983452776301, now open the football. The Naval Aide programs the code into the keypad lock. Th tumblers click. Opens. Inside the Nuclear Football, a manilla envelope, a phone handset with a red light, and a small thumb-pad.

dialogues.speaker: NAVAL AIDE
dialogues.text: Place your finger on the pad, sir. Raphelson does. A pin-prick draws a drop of blood.

dialogues.speaker: NAVAL AIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: DNA verification, shouldn't take more than a few seconds. The light on the handset turns green. The Naval Aide pick up the phone and hands it to Raphelson.  136.

dialogues.speaker: NAVAL AIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a direct line to CentCom - would you please read the target package into the phone, sir? The Aide opens the manilla folder for him and Raphelson r

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: This is the President. Target package is as follows - the cities of Tehran, Mashhad, Isfahan, and Tabriz. From the football:

dialogues.speaker: CENTCOM COMMANDER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Target package is confirmed, sir. The release of nuclear weapons falls under the two man rule - the Secretary of Defense must confirm your orders in order to launch.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: The Secretary of Defense went down on Air Force One. I am here with the Assistant Secretary who was held hostage in the White House. Mr. Secretary? He offers the phone to a SHORT BALDING MAN who looks terrified. A beat. The Assistant Secretary takes it.

dialogues.speaker: CENTCOM COMMANDER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Secretary, do you confirm the President's orders?

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT SECRETARY OF DEFENSE
dialogues.text: I do, sir.

dialogues.speaker: CENTCOM COMMANDER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Will you please read me your corresponding launch codes alphanumerically? Raphelson cracks open a plastic laminated card - "The Bis which contains the launch codes. Reading.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Bravo Victor Tango Seven Niner Zulu Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: CENTCOM COMMANDER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Secretary?  137.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT SECRETARY OF DEFENSE
dialogues.text: Bravo Victor Tango Seven Niner Zulu Charlie. I concur, sir.

dialogues.speaker: CENTCOM COMMANDER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. President, you are authorizing the release of strategic thermonuclear weapons on the country of Iran. Do you so confirm these orders?

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: CENTCOM COMMANDER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Missiles are being spun up. We will need final launch confirmation in two minutes- six? CALE (0.S.) ir? This voice from the door. John Cale. Raphelson blinks.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: John. Jesus. Ladies and Gentleman, this is John Cale, the hero of the day.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: I need a moment alone with the Speaker.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Can it wait? (gestures to the football) We're a little busy here-

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Bishop had help, sir. Someone on the outside. Raphelson looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Give us the room.

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Sir-  138.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: He's my Secret Service, for Chrissakes. Fair enough. The others file out. Leaving the two men alo Nuclear football on the table between them.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Emily okay? Cale eyes the blinking football.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Nuclear holocaust in the Middle East?

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: You think it makes me happy? They tried to destroy our country today.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Did they? He slowly moves around the table.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See the whole board, isn't that what you told me? On Raphelson. Doesn't like his tone.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: John, I'm going to have to ask you to come to the point-

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: How do you assassinate a President without making it look like an assassination? Raphelson stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: CALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You pay a man who's got nothing to lose. You send in a team of terrorists with ridiculous demands, you shoot down Air Force One, you make it about everything but assassination, so when the smoke clears, no one realizes that you've cleared the line of succession and ascended to throne.  139. Raphelson has gone very still.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: That's quite a story.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Do me a favor and don't deny it.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: What about Iran?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: You never wanted the Peace Accord. You paid Bishop, you told him this was about data-farming. You made it look like the money came from Iran. You framed him to get your war.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: This war was coming no matter what. This way we save 10 years in the desert and thousands of American lives. We end it with one shot.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: You committed treason.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: You think I hurt this country? Raphelson picks up the TV remote and clicks it on. CNN sh people gathering all over the country. Candlelight vigils People coming together, comforting one another.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This unified them. One nation, indivisible once more. United behind a common goal. Today made us stronger than ever.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Under you, right? Let me guess, the President's going to mysteriously succumb to his wounds at Bethesda.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: You're looking at the President, son.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: You're under arrest.  140.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: I don't think so. The Football squawks:

dialogues.speaker: CENTCOM COMMANDER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sir, we need final codeword conformation for launch. Raphelson reaches for the handset. Cale draws his gun.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do? Shoot the President? There are a thousand Marines outside that door and no one will believe you.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: Because you're nobody. Despite your heroics today, in the end you're just a shell shocked little shit and I'm the President of the United States!

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No, you're not. Raphelson turns to see Finnerty wheeling a very much awak Sawyer in a wheelchair. He looks at Cale in disbelief. President Sawyer picks up the handset for the football.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is President Sawyer, cancel all launch preparations and return us to DEFCON 2.

dialogues.speaker: CENTCOM COMMANDER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Roger that, sir.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: But- but, you can't! I'm the President now!

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Then consider this a coup de'tat. Take him onto custody.  141. Finnerty moves to him when Raphelson screams, pulling the gun she gave him from his pocket, levelling it at the President... BLAM! Cale fires once. The bullet rips through Raphelson' left thigh. He goes down screaming.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hurts, doesn't it? The doors fly open as everyone else rushes in at the soun of the shot. Sawyer nods to Raphelson.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please place the Speaker of the House under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: RAPHELSON
dialogues.text: (moaning) I need a hospital...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Prisons have hospitals, don't they?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: All right, then. Take him away. (to Cale) And you. Isn't this your day off?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: Then what are you still doing here? Go take your daughter to lunch. Cale smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. He turns to the door. We depart with him, leaving the President giving orders, back in charge:

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SAWYER
dialogues.text: General, get me the President of Iran on the phone...  142.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cale and Finnerty step out through the ruined Oval Office and walk across the wreckage strewn South Lawn with Emily

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: I've been thinking.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: You're the worst Secret Service Agent ever.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: How do you figure?

dialogues.speaker: FINNERTY
dialogues.text: The President was shot once in your care, you just shot another President in the leg, and although I can't prove it conclusively, I'm pretty sure you set fire to the White House.

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Well when you say it all out loud like that... Finnerty laughs. The three of them walk on. All of Washington DC laid out in front of them. Smoke ris but already a sense of community. People pulling together a city rebuilding. Emily grasps her father's hand.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Let's go home. We begin to pull up and back. The building behind them lo different. Battered, missing some pieces. But it's still the White House. A pair of F-15s ROAR OVERHEAD, flying Combat Air Patrol o Our Nation's Capital. Safe once more.
